full_content:
Re: your Skyscript subscription
Skyscript
28 Aug 2024
12
7

As many of you already know, one of my main priorities this year is to move the Skyscript membership scheme away from Patreon. This will provide a more integrated and streamlined experience, as all membership functions will be housed fully on the Skyscript site. You will have an individual login that works across the whole site. Instead of messages and updates being placed here on Patreon, there will be a dedicated area in the Skyscript forum that is only visible to members.  We will have improved facilities to provide news and notices and to continue focused discussion as a follow-up to Skyscript talks and events. You will also have more control over what you receive or choose not to receive and a better ability to share charts, graphics, assets and discussions with each other.

This migration will provide many long-term benefits — for you as a member and for the development of future Skyscript content and assets so that, next year, I can be more focused on arranging a legacy plan for the site. I am still awaiting technical information on how this will be managed on the server side. I have been informed today that everything is going well. We are in the beta-testing stage now, and the final ‘go-ahead’ to proceed with the plan should come through this weekend. Since I will be away at the AA conference for the next few days, I will give you a loose overview now of how this plan is expected to work.

Regardless of your tier, your membership payment will be suspended initially, and your membership period will be extended by four months.
This is to thank you for your patience as the production of the Skyscript newsletter has been seriously impeded this year. This grace period will allow me to get back on track without feeling too anxious about missed deadlines. (I had optimistically hoped to complete the next newsletter by the end of this month, but too many emergency problems have occurred in other areas that sucked up all my available time – my realistic target now is to coincide with the Libra ingress).
Since Mind-level subscribers have been deprived of most of their expected content, from now until the end of the year all scheduled talks and presentations are available to all members regardless of your membership tier. (This includes everything except the soul-level meetings).

The payment suspension will start in September 2024. (Most of you will make your final payment on September 1st this year.)
This suspension won't affect your access to the membership area or any posts here on Patreon.  I will still be using Patreon to circulate messages for a while, and you can still interact with posts as you always have.  The payment is being suspended, not the service.
Here is what it means in practical terms:
·      If you pay monthly – after 1st September, you will not be charged for the rest of this year.
·      If you pay annually – your pre-paid subscription period will be extended by four months.

I will also review membership prices once the subscription resumes to provide more for less. I don’t have the full details of prices at this time, but I am committed to bringing base prices down. There will also be an immediate additional benefit from the fact that the VAT currently charged on your subscription by Patreon will not be applicable once we move away from their site.
I am sure you will have questions, but be aware that I will be off social media and messaging sites (including this one) until I find my feet again after the conference. I will keep you informed as much as I can, but there is much to be done, so please bear with me as I try to keep my balance on what feels like a spinning dance floor!
-----------------------------------------------------
I have two other astro-notices to share:
 Firstly, some sad news. Kirk Little informed me yesterday that Geoffrey Cornelius passed away on Monday this week (26 August). He was diagnosed with Cancer in May this year.  Although his death was not unexpected, it still brings a great feeling of loss to our community. Those of us who knew him will have fond memories of an extremely wise, yet remarkably humble man. I genuinely think Geoffrey was one of the most impressive presenters I have ever had the pleasure of listening to at a conference, and only recently (in Dorian Greenbaum’s recent talk) we were all agreeing how his book ‘The Moment of Astrology’ is one of the most important books on astrology published in our generation. 
Geoffrey was the partner of astrologer Maggie Hyde, who will be devastated at his passing, so please hold her in your thoughts.
Secondly, some happier news for those who like to calculate charts on Apple platforms. Last year we covered news about Roger Pearson’s development of Astro-Connexions for iPads.  This is a very economical yet excellent astrology app, loaded with useful features. Further development means it is now available on all Apple platforms: iPad, Mac AND iPhone. It includes the ability to calculate Primary Directions, too, which is a first for the iPhone, as far as I’m aware.
If that sounds of interest – check out Roger’s website for the app at
 https://astroconnexions.com


That's all for now. I am back to working on PowerPoints and looking forward to seeing some of you this weekend in Leicester!

Skyscript
21 Aug 2024
2

I want to clarify that there will not be a Manilius Reading Group meeting this week.
I'm sorry to anyone who had noted that date in an earlier post; a technical glitch meant it got deleted from the members' area and because of that it fell off my radar. Mireille and I have chatted today and tried various ways to reschedule with more notice, but with the AA conference coming up for us both, some trips away scheduled, and a lot of other events planned into the next few weeks, it made the most sense to let that slide over this month and resume again on the next diarised date - 3rd October.
The attached graphic (at the top) shows our upcoming events - I always use the members area as the formal source of information as events are planned and scheduled. The next all-member event will be on 12 September, when Sheila Roher and Michele Debs will lead us through some thoughts and new perspectives on the upcoming US election.

To those of you attending the AA Conference this year - I hope you'll say "hello" and I'll look forward to seeing you there!

Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 15 Aug 2024

content_blocks.text: Hi everyone
content_blocks.html: Hi everyone

content_blocks.text: The recording from Dorian Greenbaum’s talk is now available – it is attached to this post or you can find it linked in to the member’s area.
content_blocks.html: The recording from Dorian Greenbaum’s talk is now available – it is attached to this post or you can find it linked in to the member’s area.

content_blocks.text: This took the form of Dorian delivering a paper which she hopes to have published in an academic journal next year, exploring what astrologers experience when attempting to make predictions on high-profile matters and the pressures we put ourselves under when we do that.
content_blocks.html: This took the form of Dorian delivering a paper which she hopes to have published in an academic journal next year, exploring what astrologers experience when attempting to make predictions on high-profile matters and the pressures we put ourselves under when we do that.

content_blocks.text: This led to some very lively follow up discussion. The talk opens up issues that effect us all and to which there are no easy answers, but there seemed to be a summary consensus that – as a community – we need to be wary of vocabulary used and setting out realistic expectations that we make relevant observations on patterns that can lead to reliable predictions, but we are not necessarily claiming knowledge of distant  future events before they happen.

content_blocks.author: Sheila Roher
content_blocks.text: Really appreciated Dorian's talk. I had listened to the Sophia talk which included some of this material (but without the charts!).  Garry's question --' is the truth always there' is so important to me. There certainly seem to be events in what we know as the 'future' that seem fated (we have plenty of evidence from precognitive experiences, near death experiences, psychic predictions). For example (a case I know of) of a woman  was told by a psychic (who didn't want to say this) that her husband would be dead in 5 years and he was. But there are also situations where we seem able to influence the outcome (or was that also fated?).  And then there are the consultations where we are just not ready to hear something. Thank you, Dorian and Deb and everyone who participated.

content_blocks.author: Suzanne Sanders
content_blocks.text: Such an important discussion so thank you for presenting this talk. I am struck by how much we learn from our failures... sometimes so much more than our successes. What a great teaching opportunity this failure presented.

Hi everyone
 The recording from Dorian Greenbaum’s talk is now available – it is attached to this post or you can find it linked in to the member’s area.
 This took the form of Dorian delivering a paper which she hopes to have published in an academic journal next year, exploring what astrologers experience when attempting to make predictions on high-profile matters and the pressures we put ourselves under when we do that.
 This led to some very lively follow up discussion. The talk opens up issues that effect us all and to which there are no easy answers, but there seemed to be a summary consensus that – as a community – we need to be wary of vocabulary used and setting out realistic expectations that we make relevant observations on patterns that can lead to reliable predictions, but we are not necessarily claiming knowledge of distant  future events before they happen.

The follow-up link references I can find in the chat are to the YouTube video discussion featuring David Cochrane, Steven Forrest and Giselle Terry, called ‘Building Bridges in Astrology’:
      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DBBHA305AI

There was also recommendation to an article that the late Vic Mansfield wrote in1997: 
       http://www.vicmansfield.com/philosophy-and-cosmology/an-astrophysicists-sympathetic-and-critical-view-of-astrology/

And lots of acknowledgements and recommendations to Geoffrey Cornelius’ ‘Moment of Astrology’ -  https://www.amazon.com/Moment-Astrology-Geoffrey-Cornelius/dp/1902405110?ref_=ast_author_mpb

And to Dennis Elwell’s 'Cosmic Loom' (Ed, wrote, for example):
The whole of the second complete paragraph on p.84 of the second ed. of Elwell's book is worthy of deep and prolonged reflection by astrologers. I won't type it out as it's a long piece of text, but essentially Elwell questions the whole concept of 'prediction' and suggests that what astrologers really do, if they are honest, is a balance of probabilities based on astrological symbolism - he calls this 'intelligent anticipation'.

title: MM follow up: Haniyeh assassinated / Deif confirmed dead

content_blocks.text: MM follow up: Haniyeh assassinated / Deif confirmed dead
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 1 Aug 2024

content_blocks.text: UPDATE:the chart circulated earlier was correct but there was a mistake in the data given for Haniyeh, which has now been corrected.News has also been released in the last few hours thatMohammed Deif(another of the charts profiled in our meeting on Moday) has been confirmed killed from an air strike on Gaza on 13 July. At the time it was reported that the air strike had hit a humanitarean zone and killed more than 90 civilians, but Hamas denied Deif was among the dead.
content_blocks.html:
UPDATE: the chart circulated earlier was correct but there was a mistake in the data given for Haniyeh, which has now been corrected.
News has also been released in the last few hours that Mohammed Deif (another of the charts profiled in our meeting on Moday) has been confirmed killed from an air strike on Gaza on 13 July. At the time it was reported that the air strike had hit a humanitarean zone and killed more than 90 civilians, but Hamas denied Deif was among the dead.

content_blocks.text: Israel’s Defence Minister has released a statement that they now have definite evidence Deif was killed in that strike. The BBC reports him as referring to the death of Haniyeh along with the now confirmed death of Deif as together presenting:
content_blocks.html: Israel’s Defence Minister has released a statement that they now have definite evidence Deif was killed in that strike. The BBC reports him as referring to the death of Haniyeh along with the now confirmed death of Deif as together presenting:

content_blocks.text: “a significant milestone in the dismantling of Hamas."This operation reflects the fact that Hamas is disintegrating, and that Hamas terrorists may either surrender or they will be eliminated," he added.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cpv3gpy74ydoOf the four Palestinian individual charts we looked at on Monday, only the Hamas leader and politicianYahya Sinwarremains at liberty.Marwan Barghoutiis still alive, but incarcerated in Israel.
content_blocks.html:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cpv3gpy74ydo

Of the four Palestinian individual charts we looked at on Monday, only the Hamas leader and politician Yahya Sinwar remains at liberty. Marwan Barghouti is still alive, but incarcerated in Israel.

content_blocks.text: ------End update
content_blocks.html: ------End update

content_blocks.text: In our Mundane Matters meeting on Monday, we looked at the chart of Ismail Haniyeh, with an expectation that he was under a heavy threat of assassination right now.  That happened yesterday as he was attending the inauguration of the Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian. He and his bodyguard were killed after their residence was “struck by an air-launched guided projectile” at around 2 a.m. local time Wednesday (6:30 p.m. ET Tuesday), state media said.” (NBC News)
content_blocks.html: In our Mundane Matters meeting on Monday, we looked at the chart of Ismail Haniyeh, with an expectation that he was under a heavy threat of assassination right now.  That happened yesterday as he was attending the inauguration of the Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian. He and his bodyguard were killed after their residence was “struck by an air-launched guided projectile” at around 2 a.m. local time Wednesday (6:30 p.m. ET Tuesday), state media said.” (NBC News)

content_blocks.text: https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/hamas-chief-ismail-haniyeh-killed-israeli-airstrike-iran-hamas-says-rcna164425
content_blocks.html: https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/hamas-chief-ismail-haniyeh-killed-israeli-airstrike-iran-hamas-says-rcna164425

content_blocks.text: As a reminder, Ismail is included on thepage of political chartsas the main opposition leader the Palestinian Prime Minister, with the bracketed comment “(PMdisputed& Chairman of Hamas Political Bureau).  We looked at his chart together and I drew attention to the tragic circumstances he has recently faced personally, as mentioned on his WP page:
content_blocks.html: As a reminder, Ismail is included on the page of political charts as the main opposition leader the Palestinian Prime Minister, with the bracketed comment “(PM disputed & Chairman of Hamas Political Bureau).  We looked at his chart together and I drew attention to the tragic circumstances he has recently faced personally, as mentioned on his WP page:

content_blocks.text: In October 2023, fourteen members of his family were killed in an Israeli airstrike on his family home in Gaza City, among them a brother and nephew.In November 2023, a granddaughter of his was reportedly killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City. Later that month his eldest grandson was killed in an Israeli strike.Three of his sons and three grandchildren were killed in an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip on 10 April 2024.On 25 June 2024, ten members of his family, including his 80-year-old sister, were killed in an Israeli airstrike in al-Shati refugee camp.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ismail_HaniyehThe chart of the Iranian PresidentMasoud Pezeshkianand a few other charts of relevance to Iran are also included on theMundane Matters page.  I had created them in anticipation that increased tension in Lebanon will pull Iran into the fray.  That is definitely the case now with this assassination, under these circumstances, being seen as a huge international incident and an affront to Iran, while Hamas seeks another leader with the 'same vision' to replace the one they are now treating as martyred. (AP news)https://apnews.com/live/hamas-haniyeh-iran-israel-live-updateshttps://www.skyscript.co.uk/mm.html

full_content:
MM follow up: Haniyeh assassinated / Deif confirmed dead
Skyscript
1 Aug 2024
5
7

UPDATE: the chart circulated earlier was correct but there was a mistake in the data given for Haniyeh, which has now been corrected.
News has also been released in the last few hours that Mohammed Deif (another of the charts profiled in our meeting on Moday) has been confirmed killed from an air strike on Gaza on 13 July. At the time it was reported that the air strike had hit a humanitarean zone and killed more than 90 civilians, but Hamas denied Deif was among the dead.
Israel’s Defence Minister has released a statement that they now have definite evidence Deif was killed in that strike. The BBC reports him as referring to the death of Haniyeh along with the now confirmed death of Deif as together presenting:
“a significant milestone in the dismantling of Hamas.
"This operation reflects the fact that Hamas is disintegrating, and that Hamas terrorists may either surrender or they will be eliminated," he added.
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cpv3gpy74ydo

Of the four Palestinian individual charts we looked at on Monday, only the Hamas leader and politician Yahya Sinwar remains at liberty. Marwan Barghouti is still alive, but incarcerated in Israel.
------End update

In our Mundane Matters meeting on Monday, we looked at the chart of Ismail Haniyeh, with an expectation that he was under a heavy threat of assassination right now.  That happened yesterday as he was attending the inauguration of the Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian. He and his bodyguard were killed after their residence was “struck by an air-launched guided projectile” at around 2 a.m. local time Wednesday (6:30 p.m. ET Tuesday), state media said.” (NBC News)
https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/hamas-chief-ismail-haniyeh-killed-israeli-airstrike-iran-hamas-says-rcna164425

As a reminder, Ismail is included on the page of political charts as the main opposition leader the Palestinian Prime Minister, with the bracketed comment “(PM disputed & Chairman of Hamas Political Bureau).  We looked at his chart together and I drew attention to the tragic circumstances he has recently faced personally, as mentioned on his WP page:
In October 2023, fourteen members of his family were killed in an Israeli airstrike on his family home in Gaza City, among them a brother and nephew.
In November 2023, a granddaughter of his was reportedly killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City. Later that month his eldest grandson was killed in an Israeli strike.
Three of his sons and three grandchildren were killed in an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip on 10 April 2024.
On 25 June 2024, ten members of his family, including his 80-year-old sister, were killed in an Israeli airstrike in al-Shati refugee camp.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh

The chart of the Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian and a few other charts of relevance to Iran are also included on the Mundane Matters page.  I had created them in anticipation that increased tension in Lebanon will pull Iran into the fray.  That is definitely the case now with this assassination, under these circumstances, being seen as a huge international incident and an affront to Iran, while Hamas seeks another leader with the 'same vision' to replace the one they are now treating as martyred. (AP news)

https://apnews.com/live/hamas-haniyeh-iran-israel-live-updates

https://www.skyscript.co.uk/mm.html

content_blocks.author: Wei
content_blocks.text:
I would like to know if anyone is willing to discuss the future of the UK economy. On July 29th, Prime Minister Starmer's office issued a statement saying that the UK has gone bankrupt according to the results of the fiscal review.

China also held the third plenary session of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party from July 15th to 18th. According to the communiqué, there seems to be no clear blueprint for China's economic future. President Xi Jinping is vigorously promoting China's economic transformation. Will this affect his future re-election for a fourth term?

Given the above, from what perspectives and methods should we use astrology to analyze these events?

content_blocks.author: Kealoha Cristiano
content_blocks.text:
Aloha SkyScript & STA team,
I trust you are well. 

In regards to the Mundane Matters, (I just visited the charts page). Are you going to make this video or other videos available?

I would have a day off coming soon - I would like to watch your lecture. 

If possible, okay. If not, all is well.

Sending you waves of Aloha - I am really really grateful for your work Deb - and so much respect and appreciation for the other tutors that are part of my journey Wade, Lee and Eve.

Have a blessed day/ night,

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
I am really sorry for my late reply to this message Cristiano.  I had some down-time last week due to illness and I am trying to ctach up with anything I missed during that period today.  The Mundane Matters meeting is the one event that isn't recorded. From the start, this was set up to be a friendly and informal discussion amongst all participants, that is very much 'in the moment' without any sense of being recorded or watched. I realise there are pros and cons to this and it may be that the policy changes -  I don't like to think some people are dissapointed at not being able to catch up with an event that is held at a time that is impossible to attend. The situation will stay like this for now, but I will be mindful that it needs recosideration soon.  
Thank you for your lovely sentiments too - I hope you are keeping well in yourself!

title: Mars-Uranus on Algol coming up

content_blocks.text: Mars-Uranus on Algol coming up
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 7 Jul 2024

content_blocks.text: Just passing on an interesting ‘heads up’ that originated from Sheila Roher last week when we looked at the chart of Joe Biden wondering whether he would stand down or not; and if so, when?
content_blocks.html: Just passing on an interesting ‘heads up’ that originated from Sheila Roher last week when we looked at the chart of Joe Biden wondering whether he would stand down or not; and if so, when?

content_blocks.text: Sheila pointed out how the volatileMars-Uranus conjunctionthat perfects on 15th July at26° Taurusfalls upon Biden's natal 12-th house Sun. If Biden thinks he's over the worst it seems he's got more drama coming his way, especially since this harsh conjunction also lands on the degree of the destructive fixed star,Algol. The conjunction opposes Kamala Harris’s  MC-ruler Jupiter too (not sure this is a good thing for Harris, since her political standing might be more secure by being tied to Biden). At the very least, this pair look set to have their boats rocked even more than they have been of late.
content_blocks.html: Sheila pointed out how the volatile Mars-Uranus conjunction that perfects on 15th July at 26° Taurus falls upon Biden's natal 12-th house Sun. If Biden thinks he's over the worst it seems he's got more drama coming his way, especially since this harsh conjunction also lands on the degree of the destructive fixed star, Algol. The conjunction opposes Kamala Harris’s  MC-ruler Jupiter too (not sure this is a good thing for Harris, since her political standing might be more secure by being tied to Biden). At the very least, this pair look set to have their boats rocked even more than they have been of late.

content_blocks.text: Drawing up some national foundation charts for Skyscript today, I also noticed how the conjunction is igniting the current return of Mars to its elevated and angular natal position (squared by Uranus) in the chart for the founding of the French Republic. The conjunction stirs the chart of Jordan Bardella too, who is leading the far-right opposition in the elections that are generating so much tension (and violence) across France right now.

The conjunction stirs the chart of Jordan Bardella too, who is leading the far-right opposition in the elections that are generating so much tension (and violence) across France right now.

content_blocks.text: In regard to UK politics, the conjunction lands upon the natal Moon of Tom Tugendhat, and it lights up the natal Uranus/Pluto/Saturn/Nep of Jeremy Hunt. Both of these politicians are likely to feel tense, excited, stretched and drawn out – presumably because the Conservative leadership spotlight will be zooming in their direction and holding their feet to the fire.

content_blocks.author: cerise vablais
content_blocks.text: Time has been updated to 6:11 pm for the shooting

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
It seems the time was actually 6:11 pm - earlier reports suggested a little later, but they were based on noting social media and news feeds which were subject to delay.  Drums - I also thought the right ear was significant. According to Lilly Saturn rules the right ear - CA, p.246 - and Saturn is culminating in Trump's SR this year, while ruling the 8th house and receiving the opposition of the Moon (it's not a good SR chart for Trump this year - one reason why I've been hesitant in judging out and out victory for him in the elections).  I've noticed the Trump team are directing blame on this towards Biden, by suggesting he has directed hate thoughts towards Trump.  I wonder whether this will add more pressure on Biden to step down. (Might be seen as another reason to bring in a fresh face now, who can be free of past-interaction with Trump after this very dramatic turn of events).  
What with this news this morning, and England playing in the finals tonight, I'm not sure I can keep up with all the drama going on!

content_blocks.text:

Here's a breakdown of how that all unfolded. All times are local:

18:03: He takes the stage to Lee Hazelwood’s “God Bless the USA”
18:11: Just a few minutes into his campaign speech, loud shots ring out
18:12: Secret Service agents swarm the former president before he is rushed off stage with blood near his ear and on the side of his face
18:14: Trump's motorcade leaves the rally

content_blocks.text:
The Daily Mail (right wing British tabloid press) is running a story that Michelle Obama might be tempted to run as the democratic candidate after all. Other US and UK media outlets have been running this story in recent days/ weeks too. Some say Obama and Taylor Swift are the dream ticket. 

The Mars-Uranus conjunction trines Obama's Sun at 26 Cap and opposes Swift's Mars at 26 Sco.

content_blocks.author: Karl Skellenger
content_blocks.text: I think it will be Harris, found some interesting alignments between her chart and the full moon on the first day of Democratic convention. https://open.substack.com/pub/karlskellenger/p/full-moon-rising-vs-the-lunar-eclipse?r=fjmlo&utm_medium=ios

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Mars-Uranus did their job on Marine !  They have been stymied …

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: It comes as a relief to me to see that the far right were blocked, although still very troubling to think of the political manipulations that went on to move the vote from the far right to the far left.  Anything but Macron it seems :)  -And what a Neptunian mess to wade through now :)

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text:
Thank you Deb, Sheila and everyone else for all this commentary. More nastiness and craziness on the horizon. Sigh.

On Sunday evening, the night before the Mars-Uranus conjunction, England may be in the Euros 2024 final. They've won every match so far in highly Mars-Uranus, nerve-shredding fashion already. Whoever ends up in the final, the tension will be on another level. Not sure how it can get any more acute for England football fans.

The conjunction provokes my own chart at the end of a long extended family weekend holiday. It promises to be intense even without that. Now I'm going to have to try extra hard not to be riled...

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Oh the football - I haven't even been thinking about that :)

full_content:
Oh mon erreur - one more thing ...
Skyscript
2 Jul 2024
5
2
An important PS to that previous post 
Wade informed me that Lynn Bell's presentation on the politics of France has been released on the Skyscript YouTube channel today. Thanks, Wade. I haven't seen this yet but really want to, so it will be my evening entertainment tonight.

Lynn gave this presentation as part of the InMundo / Skyscript World Astrology Summit held in March this year.  Her talk theme:
France in 2024: Calling in the gods
As France gears up for the Olympics with infrastructure upgrades, it’s keenly attuned to the April-May 2024 astrological climate. Jupiter and Uranus ping the 1st Republic's chart, and a waxing Saturn/Pluto semisquare intersects with high living costs and ecological dissent. Political entanglements threaten stability, and a potential identity crisis looms overhead.
Lynn is a fabulous astrologer who goes deep at a symbolic level - so always worth making time for if she touches a topic of interest to you. You can watch the full presentation on YouTube at this address:
https://youtu.be/0BZoEy_6rFs?si=dOtg6z4dwu-Bdtg4
If you are not yet subscribed to the channel, please click the subscribe button, which helps the channel appear in searches and means you'll get noted of our updates when you log in to YouTube. We don't post a lot of content, but what we do post is usually good quality, substantial astrology that is likely to be of interest to you.
2 comments

·
1y
Thank you, Lynn Bell, for updating us on the situation in France. The current situation in Europe is quite tense, and the economy still seems to be recovering from COVID-19 and the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Updates & follow up to last week's Mundane Matters meeting

content_blocks.text: Updates & follow up to last week's Mundane Matters meeting
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 2 Jul 2024

content_blocks.text: I have wanted to circulate this post since the close of our Mundane Matters meeting last Thursday – it has taken until now as I got a bit carried away with the preparation of it :)
content_blocks.html: I have wanted to circulate this post since the close of our Mundane Matters meeting last Thursday – it has taken until now as I got a bit carried away with the preparation of it :)

content_blocks.text: Firstly, apologies again to anyone inconvenienced by the login difficulties in the Skyscript Zoom room last Thursday, and thank you for changing venues with me so quickly. The password had indeed changed, though I had no knowledge of this! Zoom did it during a program update earlier that week. I've contacted their customer support to ask them to explain and ensure this does not happen again. The usual password has been reinstated, and I’m confident we should not have this problem repeated.
content_blocks.html: Firstly, apologies again to anyone inconvenienced by the login difficulties in the Skyscript Zoom room last Thursday, and thank you for changing venues with me so quickly. The password had indeed changed, though I had no knowledge of this! Zoom did it during a program update earlier that week. I've contacted their customer support to ask them to explain and ensure this does not happen again. The usual password has been reinstated, and I’m confident we should not have this problem repeated.

content_blocks.text: I enjoyed the last MM meeting. It was good to explore nativities relating to nations undergoing political crises and get insight from members such as Leena, who helped us understand the political landscape in India. I’ll outline what we covered first, then explain where you can easily access all the charts discussed in the meeting.
content_blocks.html: I enjoyed the last MM meeting. It was good to explore nativities relating to nations undergoing political crises and get insight from members such as Leena, who helped us understand the political landscape in India. I’ll outline what we covered first, then explain where you can easily access all the charts discussed in the meeting.

content_blocks.text: Brief meeting recap
We looked at the nativities of leaders involved in the elections looming in the UK and France (alongside their ingress charts) and the consequences of the recent election held in India.
content_blocks.html: We looked at the nativities of leaders involved in the elections looming in the UK and France (alongside their ingress charts) and the consequences of the recent election held in India.

items: UK– it was easy to observe the astrological signature of Rishi Sunak failing (e.g., tr. Saturn sq n. Saturn / Uranus on Sun and opp n. Uranus) against the more Jupiterian Keir Starmer ascending to take the Prime Ministership of the UK, bringing a swing from the right-wing politics of the Conservatives (Tory party) to the more left-leaning politics of Labour. But we also noted the chart of Nigel Farage, who seems very plugged into the Plutonic signature of this election and who – increasingly – attracts media headlines with his return to politics and the potential rise of a more extreme-right ‘Reform’ party under his leadership.  (We noted the synastry connections between Farage and Donald Trump, who he is closely aligned with politically).  The demise of the Tory party seems less about a swing from right to left for Britain and more about a broadscale lack of trust in the current government or little confidence in it having an effective grip on events or an inspiring plan moving forward.  So Britain seems ready to try any change, but its political path still seems uncertain in Starmer’s untested hands.

FRANCE– we compared the chart of Emmanuel Macron against Jordan Bardella, who seems poised to take over the presidency and move France in a far-right direction as leader of the National Rally (RN) party.  It was interesting to note how both Macron and Bardella have the Moon at 14 Taurus (the degree of Jupiter at the Aries Ingress). Bardella has Sun in Virgo (20°) in opposition to Saturn in Pisces (21°) so he is currently undergoing a Saturn return. This seems to fit the profile of a young politician taking on a great deal more responsibility, and it also meshes with the theme of the French Aries ingress, which has a strong Saturnian feel – Capricorn rising and the MC in Scorpio governed by Mars at 27° Aquarius, which falls in trine with Bardella’s North node on the MC at 26° Libra.There are several strong synastry connections between Macron and Bardella, which suggests these two are likely to be vying with each other (perhaps in alternating roles of leader and opposition leader) for a while. The younger Bardella is definitely up-and-coming and worth noting now as a new player in world politics.

INDIA– we looked at the chart of Narendra Modi, who has been Prime Minister of India since 2014, with such an overwhelming majority that he hasn’t had to deal with an effective opposition party.  A member of the right-wing BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party), although he retained his Prime Ministership this year, the recent Indian elections were seen as a major blow for him.  We compared with the chart of Rahul Gandhi, of the more democratic INC (Indian National Congress), who also claimed victory by gaining enough support to take away Modi’s majority. This has been described as a “stunning blow” for the 73-year-old Modi, who had expected a landslide victory.  It is good that we have a perfectly documented AA-rated chart for Rahul – he provided the evidence himself from published reports at the time of his birth:“Sonia Gandhi … gave birth to Rahul on 19.6.1970 at 2.28 pm. She was admitted to the hospital at 9.10 am the same day.”(full report onastro.com)With Jupiter rising upon his ascendant, translating between the trine of his elevated and rejoicing 9th-house Sun and the received sextile from his rejoicing 3rd-house Moon, and with Venus culminating in the MC, no wonder he is happy to release his data.  I chuckled when I drew up his chart and saw he was born in the day and hour of Venus, too. This man is definitely one to watch as he climbs in popularity as an upcoming leader of the world’s most populous nation.

content_blocks.text: Get quick access to all the charts

Immediately after the meeting, I planned to circulate a copy of all the charts to members. However, as I started to put a PDF together, I realised how much better it would be to create an online page where all of these charts can be found instantly and brought into view at any time with a single mouse-click on a name.
content_blocks.html: Immediately after the meeting, I planned to circulate a copy of all the charts to members. However, as I started to put a PDF together, I realised how much better it would be to create an online page where all of these charts can be found instantly and brought into view at any time with a single mouse-click on a name.

content_blocks.text: Now that we have the ‘pinnable chart’ feature on all new Skyscript pages, it is easy to fix any two charts on the screen and compare them with each other to check how political allies or enemies relate to each other or mundane astrological themes.
content_blocks.html: Now that we have the ‘pinnable chart’ feature on all new Skyscript pages, it is easy to fix any two charts on the screen and compare them with each other to check how political allies or enemies relate to each other or mundane astrological themes.

content_blocks.text: So all of the charts – including the ingress and opening of the polls charts – have been made available on the Skyscript page shown in the graphic at the top of this post:
content_blocks.html: So all of the charts – including the ingress and opening of the polls charts – have been made available on the Skyscript page shown in the graphic at the top of this post:

content_blocks.text: skyscript.co.uk/mm.html
Take a quick visit and click around. The pinnable chart options are limited on mobile and tablets, but desktop computers make the comparison of two or three charts very simple and easy.
content_blocks.html: Take a quick visit and click around. The pinnable chart options are limited on mobile and tablets, but desktop computers make the comparison of two or three charts very simple and easy.

content_blocks.text: I am really excited about the potential of what can be achieved on this page with further development and navigation enhancement. As time allows, I will add in many more mundane charts of interest to build this page into a resource library. I am currently exploring the possibility of being able to easily cross-reference any selection of 2,3 or even 4 charts together in a way that fades the background content and allows instant selection/deselection from (what will build into) an extensive collection of charts of mundane events and national leaders.
content_blocks.html: I am really excited about the potential of what can be achieved on this page with further development and navigation enhancement. As time allows, I will add in many more mundane charts of interest to build this page into a resource library. I am currently exploring the possibility of being able to easily cross-reference any selection of 2,3 or even 4 charts together in a way that fades the background content and allows instant selection/deselection from (what will build into) an extensive collection of charts of mundane events and national leaders.

content_blocks.text: Sadly, I have to park further development of this right now, but will return to it as time allows. From now on, no good chart will go to waste or fail to be archived for easy reference, and - moving forward - all charts used in Mundane Matters meetings will be shared on his page.  I have added a link to it in the members’ area.
content_blocks.html: Sadly, I have to park further development of this right now, but will return to it as time allows. From now on, no good chart will go to waste or fail to be archived for easy reference, and - moving forward - all charts used in Mundane Matters meetings will be shared on his page.  I have added a link to it in the members’ area.

content_blocks.text: Date and topics for our next meeting

The ‘4-week-on’ date for our next meeting falls on my wedding anniversary.  As I don’t want my husband demanding a divorce that day, I rescheduled to the same time on the following Monday, 29 July (details have been added to the member’s area, and I’ll circulate a reminder post with full details nearer the time).
content_blocks.html: The ‘4-week-on’ date for our next meeting falls on my wedding anniversary.  As I don’t want my husband demanding a divorce that day, I rescheduled to the same time on the following Monday, 29 July (details have been added to the member’s area, and I’ll circulate a reminder post with full details nearer the time).

content_blocks.text: Tomorrow, a new flier will be circulated with details of the summer and early autumn program of Skyscript talks and presentations. You will see we have an event purely themed on the US election scheduled for September 12th – for that reason, I would like to keep the next Mundane Matters meeting relatively US-free and continue the exploration of charts of other national leaders.  (Let’s see if I can go a whole meeting without using the T word :))
content_blocks.html: Tomorrow, a new flier will be circulated with details of the summer and early autumn program of Skyscript talks and presentations. You will see we have an event purely themed on the US election scheduled for September 12th – for that reason, I would like to keep the next Mundane Matters meeting relatively US-free and continue the exploration of charts of other national leaders.  (Let’s see if I can go a whole meeting without using the T word :))

content_blocks.text: Israel was mentioned last week, so I propose that we consider the situation there and also the chart of the Paramount Leader of China, Xi Jinping, to better understand the political situation there since China has such an important influence on world affairs.
content_blocks.html: Israel was mentioned last week, so I propose that we consider the situation there and also the chart of the Paramount Leader of China, Xi Jinping, to better understand the political situation there since China has such an important influence on world affairs.

content_blocks.text: In addition to these national issues—and especially since our next meeting coincides with a Moon-Mars-Jupiter conjunction in Gemini, with Jupiter moving into alignment with the fixed star Rigel (17° Gem)—I would like the third part of our next meeting to explore the associations and symbolism of Rigel and the constellation Orion. Rigel is one of the brightest stars in the sky, so it seems very fitting for that to get some attention as such a dramatic light show moves towards it.
content_blocks.html: In addition to these national issues—and especially since our next meeting coincides with a Moon-Mars-Jupiter conjunction in Gemini, with Jupiter moving into alignment with the fixed star Rigel (17° Gem)—I would like the third part of our next meeting to explore the associations and symbolism of Rigel and the constellation Orion. Rigel is one of the brightest stars in the sky, so it seems very fitting for that to get some attention as such a dramatic light show moves towards it.

content_blocks.text: Quick update on other news

I have prepared handouts and notes for the first part of Manilius’sAstronomicabook II - to be used in our next ‘Reading Manilius’ group meeting on 11th July. I have an interesting extract to circulate in advance of that, which will be released with further info on that meeting on Thursday this week.
content_blocks.html: I have prepared handouts and notes for the first part of Manilius’s Astronomica book II - to be used in our next ‘Reading Manilius’ group meeting on 11th July. I have an interesting extract to circulate in advance of that, which will be released with further info on that meeting on Thursday this week.

content_blocks.text: These last few months have been incredibly demanding on the back-end coding of Skyscript. It is a complex situation as we start to move towards a ‘single sign-on’ experience, but good progress is being made, and this is very exciting and important in terms of the site’s long-term development. I’m not in a good position to reveal developments yet, but want you to realise that while I have been slow in circulating the next newsletter, this is not because things are not happening.
content_blocks.html: These last few months have been incredibly demanding on the back-end coding of Skyscript. It is a complex situation as we start to move towards a ‘single sign-on’ experience, but good progress is being made, and this is very exciting and important in terms of the site’s long-term development. I’m not in a good position to reveal developments yet, but want you to realise that while I have been slow in circulating the next newsletter, this is not because things are not happening.

items: UK– it was easy to observe the astrological signature of Rishi Sunak failing (e.g., tr. Saturn sq n. Saturn / Uranus on Sun and opp n. Uranus) against the more Jupiterian Keir Starmer ascending to take the Prime Ministership of the UK, bringing a swing from the right-wing politics of the Conservatives (Tory party) to the more left-leaning politics of Labour. But we also noted the chart of Nigel Farage, who seems very plugged into the Plutonic signature of this election and who – increasingly – attracts media headlines with his return to politics and the potential rise of a more extreme-right ‘Reform’ party under his leadership.  (We noted the synastry connections between Farage and Donald Trump, who he is closely aligned with politically).  The demise of the Tory party seems less about a swing from right to left for Britain and more about a broadscale lack of trust in the current government or little confidence in it having an effective grip on events or an inspiring plan moving forward.  So Britain seems ready to try any change, but its political path still seems uncertain in Starmer’s untested hands.

FRANCE– we compared the chart of Emmanuel Macron against Jordan Bardella, who seems poised to take over the presidency and move France in a far-right direction as leader of the National Rally (RN) party.  It was interesting to note how both Macron and Bardella have the Moon at 14 Taurus (the degree of Jupiter at the Aries Ingress). Bardella has Sun in Virgo (20°) in opposition to Saturn in Pisces (21°) so he is currently undergoing a Saturn return. This seems to fit the profile of a young politician taking on a great deal more responsibility, and it also meshes with the theme of the French Aries ingress, which has a strong Saturnian feel – Capricorn rising and the MC in Scorpio governed by Mars at 27° Aquarius, which falls in trine with Bardella’s North node on the MC at 26° Libra.There are several strong synastry connections between Macron and Bardella, which suggests these two are likely to be vying with each other (perhaps in alternating roles of leader and opposition leader) for a while. The younger Bardella is definitely up-and-coming and worth noting now as a new player in world politics.

INDIA– we looked at the chart of Narendra Modi, who has been Prime Minister of India since 2014, with such an overwhelming majority that he hasn’t had to deal with an effective opposition party.  A member of the right-wing BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party), although he retained his Prime Ministership this year, the recent Indian elections were seen as a major blow for him.  We compared with the chart of Rahul Gandhi, of the more democratic INC (Indian National Congress), who also claimed victory by gaining enough support to take away Modi’s majority. This has been described as a “stunning blow” for the 73-year-old Modi, who had expected a landslide victory.  It is good that we have a perfectly documented AA-rated chart for Rahul – he provided the evidence himself from published reports at the time of his birth:“Sonia Gandhi … gave birth to Rahul on 19.6.1970 at 2.28 pm. She was admitted to the hospital at 9.10 am the same day.”(full report onastro.com)With Jupiter rising upon his ascendant, translating between the trine of his elevated and rejoicing 9th-house Sun and the received sextile from his rejoicing 3rd-house Moon, and with Venus culminating in the MC, no wonder he is happy to release his data.  I chuckled when I drew up his chart and saw he was born in the day and hour of Venus, too. This man is definitely one to watch as he climbs in popularity as an upcoming leader of the world’s most populous nation.

full_content:
Updates & follow up to last week's Mundane Matters meeting
Skyscript
2 Jul 2024
7
14
I have wanted to circulate this post since the close of our Mundane Matters meeting last Thursday – it has taken until now as I got a bit carried away with the preparation of it :)
 Firstly, apologies again to anyone inconvenienced by the login difficulties in the Skyscript Zoom room last Thursday, and thank you for changing venues with me so quickly. The password had indeed changed, though I had no knowledge of this! Zoom did it during a program update earlier that week. I've contacted their customer support to ask them to explain and ensure this does not happen again. The usual password has been reinstated, and I’m confident we should not have this problem repeated.
I enjoyed the last MM meeting. It was good to explore nativities relating to nations undergoing political crises and get insight from members such as Leena, who helped us understand the political landscape in India. I’ll outline what we covered first, then explain where you can easily access all the charts discussed in the meeting.
Brief meeting recap
We looked at the nativities of leaders involved in the elections looming in the UK and France (alongside their ingress charts) and the consequences of the recent election held in India.
UK – it was easy to observe the astrological signature of Rishi Sunak failing (e.g., tr. Saturn sq n. Saturn / Uranus on Sun and opp n. Uranus) against the more Jupiterian Keir Starmer ascending to take the Prime Ministership of the UK, bringing a swing from the right-wing politics of the Conservatives (Tory party) to the more left-leaning politics of Labour. But we also noted the chart of Nigel Farage, who seems very plugged into the Plutonic signature of this election and who – increasingly – attracts media headlines with his return to politics and the potential rise of a more extreme-right ‘Reform’ party under his leadership.  (We noted the synastry connections between Farage and Donald Trump, who he is closely aligned with politically).  The demise of the Tory party seems less about a swing from right to left for Britain and more about a broadscale lack of trust in the current government or little confidence in it having an effective grip on events or an inspiring plan moving forward.  So Britain seems ready to try any change, but its political path still seems uncertain in Starmer’s untested hands.
FRANCE – we compared the chart of Emmanuel Macron against Jordan Bardella, who seems poised to take over the presidency and move France in a far-right direction as leader of the National Rally (RN) party.  It was interesting to note how both Macron and Bardella have the Moon at 14 Taurus (the degree of Jupiter at the Aries Ingress). Bardella has Sun in Virgo (20°) in opposition to Saturn in Pisces (21°) so he is currently undergoing a Saturn return. This seems to fit the profile of a young politician taking on a great deal more responsibility, and it also meshes with the theme of the French Aries ingress, which has a strong Saturnian feel – Capricorn rising and the MC in Scorpio governed by Mars at 27° Aquarius, which falls in trine with Bardella’s North node on the MC at 26° Libra. 
There are several strong synastry connections between Macron and Bardella, which suggests these two are likely to be vying with each other (perhaps in alternating roles of leader and opposition leader) for a while. The younger Bardella is definitely up-and-coming and worth noting now as a new player in world politics.  
 INDIA – we looked at the chart of Narendra Modi, who has been Prime Minister of India since 2014, with such an overwhelming majority that he hasn’t had to deal with an effective opposition party.  A member of the right-wing BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party), although he retained his Prime Ministership this year, the recent Indian elections were seen as a major blow for him.  We compared with the chart of Rahul Gandhi, of the more democratic INC (Indian National Congress), who also claimed victory by gaining enough support to take away Modi’s majority. This has been described as a “stunning blow” for the 73-year-old Modi, who had expected a landslide victory.  It is good that we have a perfectly documented AA-rated chart for Rahul – he provided the evidence himself from published reports at the time of his birth:
“Sonia Gandhi … gave birth to Rahul on 19.6.1970 at 2.28 pm. She was admitted to the hospital at 9.10 am the same day.”
(full report on astro.com)
With Jupiter rising upon his ascendant, translating between the trine of his elevated and rejoicing 9th-house Sun and the received sextile from his rejoicing 3rd-house Moon, and with Venus culminating in the MC, no wonder he is happy to release his data.  I chuckled when I drew up his chart and saw he was born in the day and hour of Venus, too. This man is definitely one to watch as he climbs in popularity as an upcoming leader of the world’s most populous nation.
  Get quick access to all the charts
 Immediately after the meeting, I planned to circulate a copy of all the charts to members. However, as I started to put a PDF together, I realised how much better it would be to create an online page where all of these charts can be found instantly and brought into view at any time with a single mouse-click on a name.
Now that we have the ‘pinnable chart’ feature on all new Skyscript pages, it is easy to fix any two charts on the screen and compare them with each other to check how political allies or enemies relate to each other or mundane astrological themes. 
So all of the charts – including the ingress and opening of the polls charts – have been made available on the Skyscript page shown in the graphic at the top of this post:
skyscript.co.uk/mm.html
Take a quick visit and click around. The pinnable chart options are limited on mobile and tablets, but desktop computers make the comparison of two or three charts very simple and easy.
I am really excited about the potential of what can be achieved on this page with further development and navigation enhancement. As time allows, I will add in many more mundane charts of interest to build this page into a resource library. I am currently exploring the possibility of being able to easily cross-reference any selection of 2,3 or even 4 charts together in a way that fades the background content and allows instant selection/deselection from (what will build into) an extensive collection of charts of mundane events and national leaders.
 Sadly, I have to park further development of this right now, but will return to it as time allows. From now on, no good chart will go to waste or fail to be archived for easy reference, and - moving forward - all charts used in Mundane Matters meetings will be shared on his page.  I have added a link to it in the members’ area.
Date and topics for our next meeting
The ‘4-week-on’ date for our next meeting falls on my wedding anniversary.  As I don’t want my husband demanding a divorce that day, I rescheduled to the same time on the following Monday, 29 July (details have been added to the member’s area, and I’ll circulate a reminder post with full details nearer the time).
Tomorrow, a new flier will be circulated with details of the summer and early autumn program of Skyscript talks and presentations. You will see we have an event purely themed on the US election scheduled for September 12th – for that reason, I would like to keep the next Mundane Matters meeting relatively US-free and continue the exploration of charts of other national leaders.  (Let’s see if I can go a whole meeting without using the T word :))
 Israel was mentioned last week, so I propose that we consider the situation there and also the chart of the Paramount Leader of China, Xi Jinping, to better understand the political situation there since China has such an important influence on world affairs.
In addition to these national issues—and especially since our next meeting coincides with a Moon-Mars-Jupiter conjunction in Gemini, with Jupiter moving into alignment with the fixed star Rigel (17° Gem)—I would like the third part of our next meeting to explore the associations and symbolism of Rigel and the constellation Orion. Rigel is one of the brightest stars in the sky, so it seems very fitting for that to get some attention as such a dramatic light show moves towards it.
Quick update on other news
 I have prepared handouts and notes for the first part of Manilius’s Astronomica book II - to be used in our next ‘Reading Manilius’ group meeting on 11th July. I have an interesting extract to circulate in advance of that, which will be released with further info on that meeting on Thursday this week.
These last few months have been incredibly demanding on the back-end coding of Skyscript. It is a complex situation as we start to move towards a ‘single sign-on’ experience, but good progress is being made, and this is very exciting and important in terms of the site’s long-term development. I’m not in a good position to reveal developments yet, but want you to realise that while I have been slow in circulating the next newsletter, this is not because things are not happening. 
With several events organised, posts scheduled, and tasks at a point where I can ‘park for now,’ I intend to now focus fully on pulling the next newsletter together. No one talk to me for a while. Expect me to disappear from social media, etc., while I go down the mine with our next issue. I'll reappear when I have something tangible to show.
Thanks for bearing with my very chaotic schedule – I cannot believe no one has complained that the newsletter is so overdue. My Virgo nervousness is tautly stretched between relief for that and anxiety that you’ve all given up on me.
Fear not – I will be back!
Thank you for your continued support, and all the best from me for now :)
Deb

content_blocks.text: A reminder of our next Guest Event coming up next week

content_blocks.text: Malefic Planets in Astrological Magic

items: Nina Gryphon considers the deeper levels of the malefics in talismanic magic in this specialist presentation geared towards practising astrologers

content_blocks.text: Date:Wednesday, 17July 2024Start:4 pm UTC– San Francisco: 9 am| New York: 12 pm | London: 5 pm[check all local timeson this link]|duration≈75minsSkyscript Zoom link:http://us06web.zoom.us/j/6123333126- the password (Skyscript) is embedded in the link -

Astrologers and astrological magicians often hesitate to work with the malefic planets, Mars and Saturn, for fear of exacerbating harmful astrological influences. Yet these two planets hold the key to major personal development and we ignore them at our peril. In this lecture, STA instructor and astrological magician Nina Gryphon will discuss the deeper levels of the malefics, ranging from their roles in Platonic philosophy to their practical application in personal development and astrological magic.

content_blocks.author: Kealoha Cristiano
content_blocks.text:
Aloha Deb and STA team,
I trust you are well. 

Just writing to express gratitude. 

Often times, due to time difference, I can't honor the person offering the lecture. So, when you guys post the video, I can create time to watch. 

At times you guys offer new contents, interviews... and, at times, there are lectures on contents we have learned during the STA courses, (I believe, it is always great to review a topic/ material/ content - there are always gems that unveil / or  are noticed during the process).

I appreciate all of that - thanks for nurturing the STA community.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Thanks Cristiano - hoping you are keeping well.  I'm mindful of trying to shift the start times of events so that they don't make it impossible for certain regions to attend at all times - but this is where recordings prove so useful (as you say).  Aloha x

Talk recording: Phyical Descriptions in Natal & Horary Astrology
Skyscript
15 Jun 2024
14
5
For those unable to attend Morgan’s presentation on ‘Physical Descriptions in Horary and Natal Astrology’ - the recording is now linked into Patreon, and the showreel in the member’s area.
Morgan was actually very good at keeping to the scheduled 2-hour agenda – the recording is a bit longer because we had some group chat afterwards, and I forgot to end the recording.
Thank you for this Morgan – I think it was very clear to you how much all of us enjoyed it!
Mark the date - coming up
Our next meeting will be 'Mundane Matters' (for all patrons) on Thursday 27th June (10pm UTC / 6pm New York - time zone checker).
Our next presentation event will feature Nina Gryphon giving a talk on 'Malefic Planets in Astrological Magic' (body & soul patrons) on Wednesday 17th July (4pm UTC / 12pm New York - time zone checker).
 (I'll provide further reminders with fuller details on these events later.)
Have a great weekend!
Deb

I aimed to mention everyone who was attended at least one of the MRG meetings – but I’m worried my rusting brain has not remembered everything exactly. content_blocks.text: Consultation Tips for Astrologers– Ray Grasse

content_blocks.text: A very easy read, full of practical tips for working astrologers on getting straight to the heart of the chart and conveying astro info elegantly to a client. It will either enrich your practice with new insight, or you’ll enjoy seeing principles you have noted yourself getting the focused attention they deserve. This is an adapted extract from Ray’s new bookSo, What am I Doing Here Anyway?- which isout now.

content_blocks.text: The Gemini Prince– Dru Ish
content_blocks.html: The Gemini Prince – Dru Ish

content_blocks.text: A timely natal exploration where Dru leads us through some of the dramatic themes in the horoscope of Prince, who was blessed/cursed with genius and supersonic stardom.
content_blocks.html: A timely natal exploration where Dru leads us through some of the dramatic themes in the horoscope of Prince, who was blessed/cursed with genius and supersonic stardom.

content_blocks.text: Having the ability to pin the chart images proves really useful in articles like this - reading about Prince's physical attack on Sinead O’Connor, I pinned his nativity to the left and compared with hers on the right – his Saturn (23 Sag) becomes the pivot point in a partile T-square with her natal Saturn (23 Pisces) opposite a Uranus-Pluto conjunction.  Sinead also had Mars angular on the MC while Prince had Moon opposing Pluto angular on the MC conjunct Regulus.  Can you imagine the tension generated by those two when they were at odds with each other!?  Made for very powerful creativity when they were in tune with each other through.

items: Check out the redesign of theGlossary section. This is still undergoing attention right now – I am adding/correcting/updating entries every day – but it is already in good condition and shaping up nicely. I am excited about this because I see so much potential for developing the Glossary as a central research and encyclopaedic resource centre for the site:https://www.skyscript.co.uk/glossary/A
Skyscript now has the technical ability to easily integrate astro symbols into the main website text, which is going to be a great asset moving forward.

I am setting up a template to facilitate the online reproduction of valuable historical texts so that these can be produced as collaborative member efforts (i.e., front-end editing; no coding skills required). It is too early in the development stage to explain this fully yet, but to give a flavour below is a screenshot from the page which gives chapter 157 of Lilly’sChristian AstrologyVol III – one of the texts this system will make available in both HTML and flipbook/download format.

full_content:
News, notes, updates & interesting developments
Skyscript
25 May 2024
6
3


A note about recent developments and some of the new/refurbished content currently featured on the home page: https://www.skyscript.co.uk
This includes two articles that have been drawn from the newsletter. If you missed them there check them out here:
Consultation Tips for Astrologers – Ray Grasse
A very easy read, full of practical tips for working astrologers on getting straight to the heart of the chart and conveying astro info elegantly to a client. It will either enrich your practice with new insight, or you’ll enjoy seeing principles you have noted yourself getting the focused attention they deserve. This is an adapted extract from Ray’s new book   So, What am I Doing Here Anyway?  - which is out now.
The Gemini Prince – Dru Ish
A timely natal exploration where Dru leads us through some of the dramatic themes in the horoscope of Prince, who was blessed/cursed with genius and supersonic stardom.
Having the ability to pin the chart images proves really useful in articles like this - reading about Prince's physical attack on Sinead O’Connor, I pinned his nativity to the left and compared with hers on the right – his Saturn (23 Sag) becomes the pivot point in a partile T-square with her natal Saturn (23 Pisces) opposite a Uranus-Pluto conjunction.  Sinead also had Mars angular on the MC while Prince had Moon opposing Pluto angular on the MC conjunct Regulus.  Can you imagine the tension generated by those two when they were at odds with each other!?  Made for very powerful creativity when they were in tune with each other through.
Another article you MUST check out is:
Ivy Goldstein-Jacobson’s Sick Boy Horary – Maggie Hyde
I’ve updated the design of this old (largely forgotten) article and added in new resources to make the layout match the quality of the content which is very instructive. I enjoyed this on so many different levels and thoroughly recommend it – Maggie leaves us with much to think about, even asking us to question whether modern ‘astrology ethics’ are rooted in the realities of our practice (footnote 2). 
Simplified Horary Astrology – by Ivy Goldstein Jacobson
Maggie’s exploration of this poignant chart is bound to raise interest in Ivy Goldstein-Jacobson’s Simplified Horary Astrology – and knowing how difficult this text is to obtain, one of the assets I added to that page is a digital edition of the whole text.  (The quality is not AI because it is based on scanned photocopies of facsimiles from a text that had poor resolution to begin with, but it is still very legible and readable).  My initial plan was to make this text available to members only, but in the end, I compromised by making it viewable on screen to anyone but only downloadable for members.  If you want to download your own copy of the PDF for that text you can find it in the ‘extras’ section of the https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php#extras –
https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php#extras
More TA magazines – issues 2, 12 and 14
Three more issues of The Traditional Astrologer magazine have been digitalised and added to the site, meaning 8 of the 19 issues are now available to members, with four of them available to the public.  You can find full information on the Traditional Astrologer page.
Here’s the direct link to the two newly added editions that are only available to members (these links are also added to the ‘extras’ section of the members area:

Issue 2 - https://www.skyscript.co.uk/pdf/pubs/TA/2/TA_2.html#page=1
 Issue 14 - https://www.skyscript.co.uk/pdf/pubs/TA/14/TA14.html#page=1
Other developments that are ongoing or nearing completion right now:
Check out the redesign of the Glossary section. This is still undergoing attention right now – I am adding/correcting/updating entries every day – but it is already in good condition and shaping up nicely. I am excited about this because I see so much potential for developing the Glossary as a central research and encyclopaedic resource centre for the site: https://www.skyscript.co.uk/glossary/A
Skyscript now has the technical ability to easily integrate astro symbols into the main website text, which is going to be a great asset moving forward.
I am setting up a template to facilitate the online reproduction of valuable historical texts so that these can be produced as collaborative member efforts (i.e., front-end editing; no coding skills required). It is too early in the development stage to explain this fully yet, but to give a flavour below is a screenshot from the page which gives chapter 157 of Lilly’s Christian Astrology Vol III – one of the texts this system will make available in both HTML and flipbook/download format.
 Obviously, lots going on, so that’s me for now.
Have a great weekend - and ! thank you ! again for supporting Skyscript because none of this would be happening without the support of those of you who have propped the site up by subscribing to Patreaon.

Deb

title: Summer program of member talks

Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 22 May 2024

content_blocks.text: Details of the summer program of member talks has now been added to the members area - please note thatthe date of my presentation 'Providence, Prophecy & Divination in Judicial Astrology' has been put back until 12th September.  (Very sorry if this causes anybody any inconvenience - I am wrapped up in some exciting server developments at the moment and need to have a meeting with the server techician tomorrow to move forward the plan to integrate astrological symbols into article pages).  We have a lot going on meeting-wise this year so it won't be long before the next major event, which will be Morgan Le Gall leading a 2 hour workshop on how to hone the symbolism of physical descriptions in natal and horary astrology. Pin the date for that one - Thurs 13th June.Our next group meeting will be the Manilius Meeting Group next Thurday - 30th May - I will circulate a reminder about that after the weekend.

Summer program of member talks
Skyscript
22 May 2024
7
5
Details of the summer program of member talks has now been added to the members area - please note that the date of my presentation 'Providence, Prophecy & Divination in Judicial Astrology' has been put back until 12th September. (Very sorry if this causes anybody any inconvenience - I am wrapped up in some exciting server developments at the moment and need to have a meeting with the server techician tomorrow to move forward the plan to integrate astrological symbols into article pages). We have a lot going on meeting-wise this year so it won't be long before the next major event, which will be Morgan Le Gall leading a 2 hour workshop on how to hone the symbolism of physical descriptions in natal and horary astrology. Pin the date for that one - Thurs 13th June.

Our next group meeting will be the Manilius Meeting Group next Thurday - 30th May - I will circulate a reminder about that after the weekend.
More site news coming later today so bye for now
Deb

Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 15 May 2024

content_blocks.text: The Chinese Zodiac, Animal Signs & the Jupiter Cycle
with Jupiter Lai

When?:Thursday 16th May 2024|2 pm UTC[time zone checker](7 am San Francisco  |  10 am New York  |  3 pm London | 10 pm Hong Kong |  midnight Sydney)Join via: The Skyscript Zoom link:http://us06web.zoom.us/j/6123333126- the password (Skyscript) is embedded in the link.

Join us tomorrow(Thurs. 16th May) as Wade Caves invites Jupiter Lai to explain the intricate relationship between the Chinese animal signs and Western Astrology zodiac signs, all of which are influenced by the Jupiter cycle. In this year of the Dragon, we delve into the applications of these astrological systems. Chinese astrologers use these as a foundation for yearly predictions, guiding individuals on whether it will be a year of fortune or challenge for each sign. They also recommend specific lucky charms to enhance luck and prosperity. Jupiter will give hands-on insight into these fascinating astrological practices.

content_blocks.author: Wade Caves
content_blocks.text: Thank you for this interesting detail, Cristiano! I appreciate it!!

content_blocks.author: Kealoha Cristiano
content_blocks.text:
Aloha @Wade, during the seminar you asked about Air. 
I would like to share what I know based on my i-ching studies/practices, also what I learned while living in China.

The 5 elements (wood, fire, earth, metal and water) are believed to be fundamental components of the Universe... used in TCM, Feng Shui, Astrology, etc. - linked to seasons, organs in the body, seasons, emotions, etc.

Also the relationships between the elements are based on either a Generating Cycle or Controlling Cycle. 
For instance: Wood generates Fire... Wood controls Earth.

Now, back to your question, Air.. One thing that is emphasized on Tao and the i-Ching ... it's the Chi/ Ki (Vital force... here on the island, we call it Mana, and in Hindu Prana). 
It's in all things, it moves through all things... 

Basically, when treating one person we focus on balancing the relationship between the 5 elements to generate a positive Chi/Ki = air = being alive.

Well, it's just a quick response to your question.
I hope it gives you more clarity.

PS.: in Chinese/ Mandarin Air is 空气 KongQi ... the same Qi ... I mentioned above = Chi/Ki (ki = Japanese).

Sending you waves of Aloha

content_blocks.author: Lara van Zuydam
content_blocks.text: So annoyed that I can’t make this fascinating talk - will be sure to catch the recording.
