Skyscript Brainstorming meeting - recording
Skyscript
10 Dec 2023
4
Thank you to everyone who attended the brainstorming meeting yesterday. I found it tremendously helpful. Thrashing through some of the ideas has given me a much clearer sense of what needs to be done - plus a ton of extra motivation to do it.  Glad to see that my instinct of valueing links and making sure Skyscript builds strong connections to good resources elsewhere was echoed by so many of you in the chat.
Sorry that for many of you who would have liked to be there, the time of this meeting wasn't ideal - I plan to hold another meeting like this in about 6 months time, when some of the necessary facilities are in place to allow delegation of tasks.  I'll be sure to give better thought then to making sure the time is as accessible as possible, and that reminders are given more in advance.

The recording is attached to this post and can also be viewed at any time in the All Member Talks showreel in the member's area.

Here is a direct link to that showreel.

title: Issue 14: December edition of the newsletter is out!

content_blocks.text: Issue 14:  December edition of the newsletter is out!
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 9 Dec 2023

content_blocks.text: Update: Re the notice on p.7 - the three books have all now been claimed.
content_blocks.html: Update: Re the notice on p.7 - the three books have all now been claimed.

content_blocks.text: I’m never happier than when I am able to circulate the fruits of our collaborative Skyscript efforts.  The December issue of the newsletter has been released, and this is a special bumper edition to give you plenty of thought-provoking, educational and entertaining Astro-thoughts to enjoy throughout the festive season.
content_blocks.html: I’m never happier than when I am able to circulate the fruits of our collaborative Skyscript efforts.  The December issue of the newsletter has been released, and this is a special bumper edition to give you plenty of thought-provoking, educational and entertaining Astro-thoughts to enjoy throughout the festive season.

content_blocks.text: As usual, I have attached a low-resolution copy of the newsletter to this post, but the charts never look great in this version – the best viewing experience is gained through the high-resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area athttps://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php

Issue 14: December edition of the newsletter is out!
Skyscript
9 Dec 2023
10
26
Update: Re the notice on p.7 - the three books have all now been claimed.
I’m never happier than when I am able to circulate the fruits of our collaborative Skyscript efforts.  The December issue of the newsletter has been released, and this is a special bumper edition to give you plenty of thought-provoking, educational and entertaining Astro-thoughts to enjoy throughout the festive season.
As usual, I have attached a low-resolution copy of the newsletter to this post, but the charts never look great in this version – the best viewing experience is gained through the high-resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area at  https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php
Remember:  Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password is (all lower case): regio
Or, you can go straight to a full-screen flip-book view on this ISSUU link
There is a lot of news to share in this issue, and some excellent articles and contributions from Wade Caves,  Ray Grasse,  Dru Ish, Kayleigh Jean, and Eva Sylwester, as well as a humourous piece I included that was penned anonymously in 1995 by David Plant (this issue shares the sad news of his passing).
I hope you all enjoy reading this as much as I have enjoyed putting it together – I am looking forward to catching up with some of you later today!
Deb

title: Skyscript brainstorming - Sat, 9th December

content_blocks.text: Skyscript brainstorming - Sat, 9th December
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 8 Dec 2023

content_blocks.text: A reminder that there will be a Skyscript online Zoom meeting tomorrow, Saturday 9th December, which will not be an astrological talk or a presentation, but an open meeting to explore and discuss ideas and suggestions for the future development of Skyscript. This will also be an opportunity for me to provide an update on some of my plans, but I am most keen to get some community feedback at this time. I particularly want to hear ideas from members who might want to get more connected and involved.  There is also a plan to start up a monthly discussion group of mundane and astronomical themes - I would want that to be a community-led group, so I will be welcoming feedback and ideas on that.
content_blocks.html: A reminder that there will be a Skyscript online Zoom meeting tomorrow, Saturday 9th December, which will not be an astrological talk or a presentation, but an open meeting to explore and discuss ideas and suggestions for the future development of Skyscript. This will also be an opportunity for me to provide an update on some of my plans, but I am most keen to get some community feedback at this time. I particularly want to hear ideas from members who might want to get more connected and involved.  There is also a plan to start up a monthly discussion group of mundane and astronomical themes - I would want that to be a community-led group, so I will be welcoming feedback and ideas on that.

content_blocks.text: I expect the meeting to last about an hour, but have scheduled 75 mins. All Patreon members are invited to this meeting - I hope you can find time to participate.

Great meeting today. Sorry to hear about the death of your friend, but I think you took the right lesson from it in terms of looking into how to make your website outlive you. It is super important to have astrology websites that are independent of the big tech platforms — yes, there is a lot of great astrology information on YouTube, but YouTube also has the power to capriciously delete accounts with content it deems controversial. So far astrologers haven't been a major target of YouTube's purges, but how these purges historically tend to go is one group today and the next tomorrow.

title: News about a seminar with Rob Hand

content_blocks.text: News about a seminar with Rob Hand
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 21 Nov 2023

content_blocks.text: Just circulating info here about a seminar I will be presenting with Rob Hand this Sunday. It is timed for the Thanksgiving weekend as a clear indication of the mutual appreciation and respect we have for each other. Some people have overstretched the differences between us, not realising that Rob Hand and I are long-standing friends who are both concerned that good astrology research continues free of entrenched assumptions, in a way that honours the history, cultural development and practice of astrology.

content_blocks.text: Issue 13 – the  November edition of the newsletter is out!

content_blocks.html: 1 Nov 2023

content_blocks.text: After a great deal of labour pains, ‘lucky’ issue 13 of the newsletter has now been birthed!
content_blocks.html: After a great deal of labour pains, ‘lucky’ issue 13 of the newsletter has now been birthed!

content_blocks.text: The content in this issue goes deeper than Pluto’s belly button, and it's now very topical, and  ‘hot’ – so dive into it as soon as possible.
content_blocks.html: The content in this issue goes deeper than Pluto’s belly button, and it's now very topical, and  ‘hot’ – so dive into it as soon as possible.

content_blocks.text: Remember:  Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password is (all lower case):regio
Here is a quick low down –
content_blocks.html: Here is a quick low down –

items: If you haven’t read Kayleigh’s piece already, youreallywant to read that one right now, while the Samhain season is all around us.
Jason’s month ahead proved to be very ‘on point’ - even though it was written in September.  It features early-month configurations so don’t delay on that one.

Wade offers an extremely useful astro-overview of the Israel-Palestine situation.  Even if you are not a fan of mundane astrology, you will find this very easy to digest – and mind-blowing in the power of the astro-connections. Note the seminar Wade is giving on 3rd November to follow this piece up – you will find details on page 25.

Abigail has penned a top-notch opinion piece. I happen to agree with every word she says. Whether you do or not, you will have to agree that her points are persuasive and very elegantly made – Abigail: once again I applaud you :)

My translation of Firmicus ‘On the Signs’ has been completed and accompanied with a collection of helpful tables.There's other bits and bobs in too. Remember, we LOVE to get comments, feedback, suggestions – even criticisms (a little bit) as evidence that our thoughts are drifting through to yours!

content_blocks.text: Hope you enjoy the read!

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Abigail has put into words how I’ve always felt about astrology and I 100% agree with her view: it is an Art, of the heart and soul. When a message is deciphered there is a feeling of deep connection (I get goosebumps when that happens) and it cannot be taught just as set pieces. It is like a ‘religious’ calling - hence ‘divination’ being from the divine. I find SM very depressing when I see the Astro babble and other rubbish being said/peddled as astrology.  Wisdom takes too long in our day and age apparently- although not much is achieved without it ultimately. Thanks 🙏 again for this thought-provoking piece.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: I also agree  - with both of you :)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: There was a mistake with the Sam Bankman-Fried trial commencement chart on page 18 - it was showing the same chart as the Trump commencement trial - this has been fixed now, in case anyone got confused about that.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: And here’s the result ! Not going his way indeed ! https://www.theguardian.com/business/live/2023/nov/02/sam-bankman-fried-verdict-trial-latest-sbf-ftx-updates?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

content_blocks.author: Ray Grasse
content_blocks.text: Outstanding issue; just glancing through it this morning I found any number of useful ideas. (And as for Adam Johnson's freak accident - what an uncanny - if horrific - expression of transiting Uranus on someone's Mars... ) (I hadn't realized that occurred in a public game, btw; that had to have been traumatic for all present.)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
Yes, absolutely Ray. From what I gather, people in the crowd were screaming, and some were passing out. My daughter is still very upset by the shock of the awful situation.  When Adam bled out the release of blood was very significant, and if you can imagine how this contrasted with the white ice of the surroundings that gives a sense of the emotional contrast too: a very happy, friendly crowd all met shock and horror together through the tragedy affecting a talented, lovely young man.  The Uranus-Mars is vivid, as is the association with Algol too.

Thank you so much for the encouraging feedback!

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Wow 🤩 another stunner I can’t wait to read it all through (inc the footnotes !! ) - thanks Deb and all contributors 🙏😍

content_blocks.text: I was hoping for that Mundane topic. It is my most favorite after Horary. Thank you

content_blocks.text: Plenty of mundane content here in this one Zin - I think you'll have plenty to explore here.

Issue 13 – the November edition of the newsletter is out!
Skyscript
1 Nov 2023
13
16

After a great deal of labour pains, ‘lucky’ issue 13 of the newsletter has now been birthed!
The content in this issue goes deeper than Pluto’s belly button, and it's now very topical, and  ‘hot’ – so dive into it as soon as possible.
As usual, I have attached a low-resolution copy of the newsletter to this post, but the best viewing experience is gained through the high-resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area at  https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php
Remember:  Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password is (all lower case): regio

Here is a quick low down –
If you haven’t read Kayleigh’s piece already, you really want to read that one right now, while the Samhain season is all around us.
Jason’s month ahead proved to be very ‘on point’ - even though it was written in September.  It features early-month configurations so don’t delay on that one.
Wade offers an extremely useful astro-overview of the Israel-Palestine situation.  Even if you are not a fan of mundane astrology, you will find this very easy to digest – and mind-blowing in the power of the astro-connections. Note the seminar Wade is giving on 3rd November to follow this piece up – you will find details on page 25.
Abigail has penned a top-notch opinion piece. I happen to agree with every word she says. Whether you do or not, you will have to agree that her points are persuasive and very elegantly made – Abigail: once again I applaud you :)
My translation of Firmicus ‘On the Signs’ has been completed and accompanied with a collection of helpful tables.

There's other bits and bobs in too. Remember, we LOVE to get comments, feedback, suggestions – even criticisms (a little bit) as evidence that our thoughts are drifting through to yours!
Hope you enjoy the read!
(And thanks for your patience with this one)
Deb

title: Mars, Scorpio & the ‘Great Work’ - by Kayleigh Jean

content_blocks.text: Mars, Scorpio & the ‘Great Work’ - by Kayleigh Jean
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 27 Oct 2023

content_blocks.text: I don’t want to hold this gem of an article back any longer.  Luckily, I have it as a stand-alone PDF file from when I asked Kayleigh to approve its layout for publication.This is a very timely piece which will open your eyes to the profound and enigmatic symbolism that surrounds this year’s Halloween.  I so enjoyed the time I spent prepping this for publication - when I was feeling ‘under the weather’ I am certain it helped me get better because it gave me such pleasure to play a part in sharing work of this nature with other astrologers.I also noticed Kayleigh giving credit to thoughts inspired in last issue’s article on Virgo by Abigail Joy - and if you notice, within that, Abigail gave credit to thoughts inspired by Roz Park when she gave her Skyscript talk on Egyptian Symbolism. So something beautiful is swilling around here and developing finer points of Astro-symbolism - despite my moans and grumbles about thing’s that are standing in my way right now, my nasal steam recedes upon contemplation of the ‘Great Work’ Kayleigh alludes to. :)
content_blocks.html:
I don’t want to hold this gem of an article back any longer.  Luckily, I have it as a stand-alone PDF file from when I asked Kayleigh to approve its layout for publication.
This is a very timely piece which will open your eyes to the profound and enigmatic symbolism that surrounds this year’s Halloween.  I so enjoyed the time I spent prepping this for publication - when I was feeling ‘under the weather’ I am certain it helped me get better because it gave me such pleasure to play a part in sharing work of this nature with other astrologers.
I also noticed Kayleigh giving credit to thoughts inspired in last issue’s article on Virgo by Abigail Joy - and if you notice, within that, Abigail gave credit to thoughts inspired by Roz Park when she gave her Skyscript talk on Egyptian Symbolism. So something beautiful is swilling around here and developing finer points of Astro-symbolism - despite my moans and grumbles about thing’s that are standing in my way right now, my nasal steam recedes upon contemplation of the ‘Great Work’ Kayleigh alludes to. :)

content_blocks.text: Hope everyone has a great weekend.! (I also hope to have some better news to share with you soon - if things go according to plan for a discussion I’m holding over the weekend)Best wishes to all (I am a little less stressed now) :)Deb
content_blocks.html:
Hope everyone has a great weekend.! (I also hope to have some better news to share with you soon - if things go according to plan for a discussion I’m holding over the weekend)

Best wishes to all (I am a little less stressed now) :)
Deb

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: What a fascinating and very informative article - such research befitting the sign ! How on point your part about Seaborg and Plutonium - those topics being exposed again this year as Oppenheimer came out in July.  Also loved the glyph symbolism explained and the letter M - as a Sun/Pluto in Virgo with M how could I not 👍😉

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Thanks Jason x How sad to read that the lessons of the past are not being heeded and more destructive weapons are being built. Kaileigh was sadly spot on. In the current world context it is more than worrying - sigh 😮‍💨 as you say !

content_blocks.author: Emma Gardiner
content_blocks.text: What a lovely article to start my Saturday morning. I've always been fascinated in the glyphs, I was particularly interested to read about the symbolism of the letter M.

content_blocks.author: Michele M Debs
content_blocks.text: It is clear that much work and research went into this article, and I so appreciate the information. An excellent piece!!! full_content:
Mars, Scorpio & the ‘Great Work’ - by Kayleigh Jean
Skyscript
27 Oct 2023
9
5
 I don’t want to hold this gem of an article back any longer.  Luckily, I have it as a stand-alone PDF file from when I asked Kayleigh to approve its layout for publication.
This is a very timely piece which will open your eyes to the profound and enigmatic symbolism that surrounds this year’s Halloween.  I so enjoyed the time I spent prepping this for publication - when I was feeling ‘under the weather’ I am certain it helped me get better because it gave me such pleasure to play a part in sharing work of this nature with other astrologers.
I also noticed Kayleigh giving credit to thoughts inspired in last issue’s article on Virgo by Abigail Joy - and if you notice, within that, Abigail gave credit to thoughts inspired by Roz Park when she gave her Skyscript talk on Egyptian Symbolism. So something beautiful is swilling around here and developing finer points of Astro-symbolism - despite my moans and grumbles about thing’s that are standing in my way right now, my nasal steam recedes upon contemplation of the ‘Great Work’ Kayleigh alludes to. :)
Hope everyone has a great weekend.! (I also hope to have some better news to share with you soon - if things go according to plan for a discussion I’m holding over the weekend)

Best wishes to all (I am a little less stressed now) :)
Deb

title: It never rains but it pours …

content_blocks.text: It never rains but it pours …
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 27 Oct 2023

content_blocks.text: A message from my iPadSome of you might know that my home town (in Nottinghamshire, UK) has suffered bad floods this last week. It has been pretty serious but I’ve been fortunate and only suffered inconveniences, including losing use of the car, and power cuts which also knock out internet access.The computer has been playing up all week, so this morning, when Parallels advised an update to run Janus software, I decided to update my Mac operating system at the same time.Just as I was doing that we experienced another brief power cut, and this unfortunate timiming completely wrecked my computer hard drive! I’ve spent the whole of today trying to restore and repair, and have taken the computer to several places to see if I can book a repair in less than the 10 days I’ve been told it will take for someone to give it the deep-level investigation that is the only hope of a possible fix now.I can’t wait 10 days for a computer so I’ve ordered a new system today that will arrive over the weekend.To say I am frustrated is the understatement of the decade.  I would like you to imagine me with a totally split personality right now — one half of me is a raging Taurean with steam pouring out of my nose and my ears; the other half of me is telling myself to “get a grip” and stay serene Since this is all very piddly in the greater scheme of things.As everyone knows, you only have a complete computer breakdown at the time that you need it most. I am desperate to complete and circulate the next newsletter but it certainly feels like this 13th issue is cursed!For now I only have my iPad and it is hopeless trying to work on this.Please bear with me while I sort things out (again).  In the meantime I am going to circulate one part of the newsletter that is already done because it is a wonderful article by Kayleigh Jean which is very  topical and I don’t want this one to “miss its moment”.I’ll make a separate post about that very shortly.
content_blocks.html:
A message from my iPad

Some of you might know that my home town (in Nottinghamshire, UK) has suffered bad floods this last week. It has been pretty serious but I’ve been fortunate and only suffered inconveniences, including losing use of the car, and power cuts which also knock out internet access.
The computer has been playing up all week, so this morning, when Parallels advised an update to run Janus software, I decided to update my Mac operating system at the same time.
Just as I was doing that we experienced another brief power cut, and this unfortunate timiming completely wrecked my computer hard drive! I’ve spent the whole of today trying to restore and repair, and have taken the computer to several places to see if I can book a repair in less than the 10 days I’ve been told it will take for someone to give it the deep-level investigation that is the only hope of a possible fix now.
I can’t wait 10 days for a computer so I’ve ordered a new system today that will arrive over the weekend.
To say I am frustrated is the understatement of the decade.  I would like you to imagine me with a totally split personality right now — one half of me is a raging Taurean with steam pouring out of my nose and my ears; the other half of me is telling myself to “get a grip” and stay serene Since this is all very piddly in the greater scheme of things.
As everyone knows, you only have a complete computer breakdown at the time that you need it most. I am desperate to complete and circulate the next newsletter but it certainly feels like this 13th issue is cursed!
For now I only have my iPad and it is hopeless trying to work on this.
Please bear with me while I sort things out (again).  In the meantime I am going to circulate one part of the newsletter that is already done because it is a wonderful article by Kayleigh Jean which is very  topical and I don’t want this one to “miss its moment”.
I’ll make a separate post about that very shortly.

And running Janus 4 through Crossover had been my dream Astro-solution, so I was heart-sick by that loss, and I’m still getting over it (doesn’t seem any way to get Janus 4 again now).  I also had Janus 5 running through Parallels, but never liked that as much - and then today trying to update Parallels to get Janus 5 working more efficiently on my Mac was what led to the current disaster. full_content:
It never rains but it pours …
Skyscript
27 Oct 2023
10
14

A message from my iPad

Some of you might know that my home town (in Nottinghamshire, UK) has suffered bad floods this last week. It has been pretty serious but I’ve been fortunate and only suffered inconveniences, including losing use of the car, and power cuts which also knock out internet access.
The computer has been playing up all week, so this morning, when Parallels advised an update to run Janus software, I decided to update my Mac operating system at the same time.
Just as I was doing that we experienced another brief power cut, and this unfortunate timiming completely wrecked my computer hard drive! I’ve spent the whole of today trying to restore and repair, and have taken the computer to several places to see if I can book a repair in less than the 10 days I’ve been told it will take for someone to give it the deep-level investigation that is the only hope of a possible fix now.
I can’t wait 10 days for a computer so I’ve ordered a new system today that will arrive over the weekend.
To say I am frustrated is the understatement of the decade.  I would like you to imagine me with a totally split personality right now — one half of me is a raging Taurean with steam pouring out of my nose and my ears; the other half of me is telling myself to “get a grip” and stay serene Since this is all very piddly in the greater scheme of things.
As everyone knows, you only have a complete computer breakdown at the time that you need it most. I am desperate to complete and circulate the next newsletter but it certainly feels like this 13th issue is cursed!
For now I only have my iPad and it is hopeless trying to work on this.
Please bear with me while I sort things out (again).  In the meantime I am going to circulate one part of the newsletter that is already done because it is a wonderful article by Kayleigh Jean which is very  topical and I don’t want this one to “miss its moment”.
I’ll make a separate post about that very shortly.

title: May need to postpone & delay a little right now

content_blocks.text: May need to postpone & delay a little right now
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 19 Oct 2023

content_blocks.text: Hi everyone
content_blocks.html: Hi everyone

content_blocks.text: Without making a definite statement, for the sake of anyone planning ahead I want to give warning that I might have to cancel/postpone next week’s member's meeting planned for 25th October.  I am not feeling too well at the moment – I felt my energies drop dramatically at last weekend’s AA conference, where the slightest exertion left me struggling for breath (my talks were delivered, but with what felt like a great deal of strain on my part).
content_blocks.html: Without making a definite statement, for the sake of anyone planning ahead I want to give warning that I might have to cancel/postpone next week’s member's meeting planned for 25th October.  I am not feeling too well at the moment – I felt my energies drop dramatically at last weekend’s AA conference, where the slightest exertion left me struggling for breath (my talks were delivered, but with what felt like a great deal of strain on my part).

content_blocks.text: Upon returning home I felt even more exhausted, and I have lost my energy and my voice – I am Taurean, so always the voice is the first to go when I am under stain, and infection always comes out ‘in the throat’.  What I have feels like covid, although the tests I have taken are negative, so maybe it is just the flu.

May need to postpone & delay a little right now
Skyscript
19 Oct 2023
12
15
Hi everyone
Without making a definite statement, for the sake of anyone planning ahead I want to give warning that I might have to cancel/postpone next week’s member's meeting planned for 25th October.  I am not feeling too well at the moment – I felt my energies drop dramatically at last weekend’s AA conference, where the slightest exertion left me struggling for breath (my talks were delivered, but with what felt like a great deal of strain on my part).
Upon returning home I felt even more exhausted, and I have lost my energy and my voice – I am Taurean, so always the voice is the first to go when I am under stain, and infection always comes out ‘in the throat’.  What I have feels like covid, although the tests I have taken are negative, so maybe it is just the flu.
It feels good to be home, so hopefully a few days of not pushing myself too hard will be all I need to perk up again.  I am having a few hours of brain function each day and enjoying working on the newsletter.  As I don’t have it in me to ‘ramp up’ my energies right now, I am putting aside the ingress as a ‘deadline’ but look forward to circulating that as soon as I can.  (There is a really great article within it by Kayleigh Jean exploring the symbolism of Scorpio in fascinating ways, and I am very excited about sharing that with you).
I hope my current inadequacy is not too inconvenient for anyone.
Sending my best wishes to you all in what seems like a very sad time for the world.

title: September edition of the newsletter - # 12 - is out!

content_blocks.text: September edition of the newsletter - # 12 - is out!
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 31 Aug 2023

content_blocks.text: I am so happy to be able to share and distribute the latest edition of the newsletter– there are some really wonderful contributions here from Abigail, Dru, Jason, Sheila and Michele. Thank you so much for giving us the fruits of your labours. I deliberately placed the articles by Dru and Sheila right next to each other, because they are both beautifully written provocative articles but the contrast in the mood they will generate is likely to be remarkable (and I want you to dwell on that :))
content_blocks.html: I am so happy to be able to share and distribute the latest edition of the newsletter – there are some really wonderful contributions here from Abigail, Dru, Jason, Sheila and Michele. Thank you so much for giving us the fruits of your labours. I deliberately placed the articles by Dru and Sheila right next to each other, because they are both beautifully written provocative articles but the contrast in the mood they will generate is likely to be remarkable (and I want you to dwell on that :))

content_blocks.text: Whilst the previous issue had quite a strong historical basis (but was a little short on topical material), I have flipped to other side here. I’m sorry, but I wasn't able to include the planned continuation of the Firmicus translation or the first part of the series on Babylonian planetary myths in this issue – when you read the introduction you will understand the reason why.  But these are already slotted into the next issue and will be good to go then, so it will all work out over time.
content_blocks.html: Whilst the previous issue had quite a strong historical basis (but was a little short on topical material), I have flipped to other side here. I’m sorry, but I wasn't able to include the planned continuation of the Firmicus translation or the first part of the series on Babylonian planetary myths in this issue – when you read the introduction you will understand the reason why.  But these are already slotted into the next issue and will be good to go then, so it will all work out over time.

content_blocks.text: This is quite a large issue, with a lot for you to explore and digest, mainly themed on Virgo and Mercury.  Every page is worth reading IMO – this is really info-packed. And please remember, I am now due for my once-after-every-5-months seasonal break, so there won’t be a newsletter next month.  The next one – issue 13 – will be ready to circulate at the end of October.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: I loved Abigail’s piece on Virgo especially the idea of the Virgin birth and barrenness and how it is paradoxical - like a lot of Mercury ruled topics. Indeed looking at Al Biruni in the book of instruction on the elements of astrology in his chapter 354 on fertile and barren signs he puts Virgo under sterility but then in the same sentence states ‘the production of twins is specially in charge of Gemini but also is favoured by Virgo’ ! And the last sentence states ‘Virgo is called mistress of three forms and Gemini as many-faced, because they denote not only twins  but three if more children’ - so yes the older vision of the virile maiden seems apt. NB: as a Gemini Rising Sun Virgo and Mercury ruling my 5th house I am the proud mother of twins and a son ! I challenge the barrenness 👍 thanks again Abigail !

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Yes - it is quite profound -  I know that Abigail was quite enthused after the presentation by Roz, because that firmed up some ideas she was shaping at the time. Came together beautifully - and what a great example you are Mireille! :)

full_content:
September edition of the newsletter - # 12 - is out!
Skyscript
31 Aug 2023
9
9
I am so happy to be able to share and distribute the latest edition of the newsletter – there are some really wonderful contributions here from Abigail, Dru, Jason, Sheila and Michele. Thank you so much for giving us the fruits of your labours. I deliberately placed the articles by Dru and Sheila right next to each other, because they are both beautifully written provocative articles but the contrast in the mood they will generate is likely to be remarkable (and I want you to dwell on that :))
Whilst the previous issue had quite a strong historical basis (but was a little short on topical material), I have flipped to other side here. I’m sorry, but I wasn't able to include the planned continuation of the Firmicus translation or the first part of the series on Babylonian planetary myths in this issue – when you read the introduction you will understand the reason why.  But these are already slotted into the next issue and will be good to go then, so it will all work out over time.
This is quite a large issue, with a lot for you to explore and digest, mainly themed on Virgo and Mercury.  Every page is worth reading IMO – this is really info-packed. And please remember, I am now due for my once-after-every-5-months seasonal break, so there won’t be a newsletter next month.  The next one – issue 13 – will be ready to circulate at the end of October.
I have included a link to a low resolution PDF copy to this post, with the reminder that the full resolution copy is MUCH MUCH BETTER, and available to view or download from the member's area - or you can go straight to a full screen flip-book copy here:

https://issuu.com/sta_astrology/docs/skyscript_newsletter_12?fr=sNDVlZTY1MTA3Njk
Hope you enjoy the read!

title: Ukraine-Russia grain attacks

content_blocks.text: Ukraine-Russia grain attacks
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 3 Aug 2023

content_blocks.text: This is horrible news, but relates directly to what Jason wrote about in the last issue of the newsletter. He gave a very specific warning about the symbolism of the Full Moon of 1st August affecting Ukraine badly, with symbolism pointedly relating to the Black Sea Grain Deal, and that region remaining a hot spot for concern for the rest of this month.
content_blocks.html: This is horrible news, but relates directly to what Jason wrote about in the last issue of the newsletter. He gave a very specific warning about the symbolism of the Full Moon of 1st August affecting Ukraine badly, with symbolism pointedly relating to the Black Sea Grain Deal, and that region remaining a hot spot for concern for the rest of this month.

content_blocks.text: Within hours of that lunation, Russian drones attacked port and grain facilities in the Odesa region. The news reports broke on the morning of the 2nd August with varying accounts of the attacks being "overnight" or during the early hours of the 2nd August. The price of wheat jumped 4% overnight as 40,000 tonnes of grain destined for African countries were destroyed, along with the grain storage facilities. The targetted port at Izmail is within 1km of Romanian territory, and the Romania president has caused the attacks "war crimes". This is definitely a political situation of great consequence and concern - if you haven't read it yet, take a look at the chart for yourself to understand why the situation caught Jason's eye weeks ago.

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text:
So I really enjoyed Neptunalia, which was hilariously "Neptunian" :) Having a very "Neptunian" family, I will just add a brief sketch: Neptune is an inspiration and a deceiver, a musician and a dreamer, an addict and a liar, a drinker and a dealer, a tramp and a healer. 
I am one of three children of a woman born under a very tight Moon Neptune conjunction. A keen horsewoman when young, she yearned to become a doctor but had parents who did not believe in education for women. Her father inherited a shipping company, and her mother was an artist. She married a man who had only ever worked on the sea, and when he wasn't there, he was painting. During her lifetime, she had two boats named after her.
My siblings and I all have hard Neptune Moon contacts. My sister trained as a nurse, although her last job was as a chef on a trans-Atlantic yacht charter; she also volunteered on the inshore lifeboat (my mother raised the money to have this built). My brother has made and ridden surfboards all his life, although now he works mainly in a boat yard, and in his spare time, he is very involved with the local rowing club, another project my mother helped to found; his wife runs an organisation that looks after fisherman's welfare. Always "cursed" with an overactive imagination, I ran away from home at an early age and got involved with a different kind of life... exploring mysticism, divination and the unseen realms. My children reflect my 5th house Neptune, one with a Moon Neptune conjunction, the other, a  12th house Moon. Both are keen swimmers (I taught them both before they were 5), they also play music, and one has trained in social care; their father is a fishing guide.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
LOL - wasn't it!?  A lot of fun but part of me wants to chalk that down to a practice event with an eye to a more global 24-hour event next year with a program of speakers - partnering with others, so it can roll right around the world and folks can dip in for an hour or two when the time zone swings round to them. I like the idea of everyone having a certain day to think about astrology and revive an ancient festival. We'll see - since then I've noticed some amazing Neptune events (and horasres), and I keep thinking "that would be such a good piece to feature ...
But wow Joanna - what a backstory and interesting family history (and lineage) history you have. Your mother sounds like a perfect case study for the signature of Neptune in the natal, and she definitely passed that down the family line - strong Moon-Neptune aspects: no getting away from the sea for you lot ! LOL

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Well sleuthed Joanna! :) - And in keeping with our theme - Claudia's Mercury is in a partile trine with her Neptune at 27 Taurus - and both make a trine to Wonder's Mercury at 24 Capricorn. So a lovely Mercury-Neptune ground trine there, with venus flowing into everything :)

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: I am just catching up on this, and have just listened to the story of Lady Wonder. It reminded me of one of our dogs, that my mother had, who always "knew" when my brother was returning home.... this was in the eighties and he was always on some surf safari or other to some far-flung destination.... and never communicated when he was to come back home. I decided that rather than the dog being "psychic" as my mother insisted, it was rather that the dog was aware of my mother's psychic abilities, which, with a Moon Neptune conjunction, she undoubtedly had. I thought it would be interesting to see the chart of the lady who reared the foal and who was her keeper.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Wouldn't that be an interesting synastry comparison?  I've just done a quick search, but it seems that unless someone is signed up to Ancestry.com (or some such) Claudia's birth date is not known - only that she was born in Chesterfield, Virginia in 1887. But I can't get the date, sadly!  Here is the link that identifies her on their census, but to get into other pages requires a membership - https://www.ancestry.com/1940-census/usa/Virginia/Claudia-Fonda_vv7rq

content_blocks.author: Sheila Roher
content_blocks.text: Looking forward to the recording-- was so sorry to miss the real event.

content_blocks.author: Louise Edington
content_blocks.text: Missed it! I really should check Patreon more!

Thank you to everyone able to join with me for Neptunalia today - it is always lovely and heartening for me to meet up and actually see you again.  For those who may want to catch up later, the recording is now available, here on Patreon and also in the Members area.

Some follow up:

I have noticed Patreon seems to be having some server connections tonight- I have tried to respond to a coyuple of messages but the system keeps crashing on me.  I might give up soon and try again tomorrow.

Cheers everyone !

content_blocks.text: -----Imagine the inverse of Saturnalia.  The Roman festival of Neptunalia, honouring the God of Waters, was always held in the height of summer (around 23rd July). Equated with Poseidon, Lord of all things moist or misty, and also known asNeptunus Equester,‘nebulous horse-lord’, Jupiter’s older brother is the god of horses, horsemanship (and horse racing), as well as the sea, whose rage produces storms, floods, tempests and earthquakes. This festival is still held in parts of the world under different guises (e.g., the TunisianCarnival of Awussu), but why in the hottest, drought-filled time of year?  Thinkmanifestation!
content_blocks.html:
-----

Imagine the inverse of Saturnalia.  The Roman festival of Neptunalia, honouring the God of Waters, was always held in the height of summer (around 23rd July). Equated with Poseidon, Lord of all things moist or misty, and also known as Neptunus Equester, ‘nebulous horse-lord’, Jupiter’s older brother is the god of horses, horsemanship (and horse racing), as well as the sea, whose rage produces storms, floods, tempests and earthquakes. This festival is still held in parts of the world under different guises (e.g., the Tunisian Carnival of Awussu), but why in the hottest, drought-filled time of year?  Think manifestation!

content_blocks.author: Alberto Forero
content_blocks.text:
Thanks for the awesome discussion, Deb! When you were talking about the need to set up a veil between oneself and the Neptunian sensitivity, it reminded me of this diorama in the Museum of Natural History in New York. It shows a Yakut shaman in Siberian healing a woman 'whose soul has been captured by malevolent spirits'. The shaman has an assistant (to the right) who is holding a chain around the shaman, so that he can find healing magic in the other world, but since this is a dangerous pursuit, the chain is to make sure that he does not fall into the other world and get trapped there. He has a healthy respect for the overwhelming, disintegrating power of that other world. You could extend the analogy to substance abuse (over-dosing, burnout, dopehead, fiend, junkie, stoner, zombie) You have to be careful when playing with spiritual or chemical fire. The models look a little wonky, but I thought you'd find it interesting: 

https://www.amnh.org/exhibitions/permanent/asian-peoples/yakut-shaman-s-robe

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
It is fascinating Alberto. And a good reminder that tapping into Neptune to dissolve the boundaries can be mind-blowing and enticing, but it can also be devastatingly weakening and debilitating if control is lost. Having a sense of psychic armour is important - in practical real life too (like, emotional interactions with other people). I want to say that there is an art to being able to sympathise and relate without empathising to the degree that you get too absorbed into it, but there is also the natural proclivity too. Neptunian types have it hard in that regard.
“You have to be careful when playing with spiritual or chemical fire” – that is so true. I get a bit concerned with rapid popularisation and over-exposure of esoteric subjects on social media platforms like Twitter, etc (where it seems like just a fun thing to do). I wonder how prepared some of the young people are to deal with the consequences of what they are dabbling with.  (BTW, I imagine myself having a coat like that wrapped around me every time I go on Twitter, LOL)

Imagine the inverse of Saturnalia.  The Roman festival of Neptunalia, honouring the God of Waters, was always held in the height of summer (around 23rd July). Equated with Poseidon, Lord of all things moist or misty, and also known as Neptunus Equester, ‘nebulous horse-lord’, Jupiter’s older brother is the god of horses, horsemanship (and horse racing), as well as the sea, whose rage produces storms, floods, tempests and earthquakes. This festival is still held in parts of the world under different guises (e.g., the Tunisian Carnival of Awussu), but why in the hottest, drought-filled time of year?  Think manifestation!
We will gather as a collective to reflect on the mythological,  astronomical, historical and astrological - an all round homage to Neptune

When you were talking about the need to set up a veil between oneself and the Neptunian sensitivity, it reminded me of this diorama in the Museum of Natural History in New York. It shows a Yakut shaman in Siberian healing a woman 'whose soul has been captured by malevolent spirits'. The shaman has an assistant (to the right) who is holding a chain around the shaman, so that he can find healing magic in the other world, but since this is a dangerous pursuit, the chain is to make sure that he does not fall into the other world and get trapped there. He has a healthy respect for the overwhelming, disintegrating power of that other world. You could extend the analogy to substance abuse (over-dosing, burnout, dopehead, fiend, junkie, stoner, zombie) You have to be careful when playing with spiritual or chemical fire. The models look a little wonky, but I thought you'd find it interesting: 

https://www.amnh.org/exhibitions/permanent/asian-peoples/yakut-shaman-s-robe
1
1
Skyscript
AUTHOR
·
2y
It is fascinating Alberto. And a good reminder that tapping into Neptune to dissolve the boundaries can be mind-blowing and enticing, but it can also be devastatingly weakening and debilitating if control is lost. Having a sense of psychic armour is important - in practical real life too (like, emotional interactions with other people). I want to say that there is an art to being able to sympathise and relate without empathising to the degree that you get too absorbed into it, but there is also the natural proclivity too. Neptunian types have it hard in that regard.
“You have to be careful when playing with spiritual or chemical fire” – that is so true. I get a bit concerned with rapid popularisation and over-exposure of esoteric subjects on social media platforms like Twitter, etc (where it seems like just a fun thing to do). I wonder how prepared some of the young people are to deal with the consequences of what they are dabbling with.  (BTW, I imagine myself having a coat like that wrapped around me every time I go on Twitter, LOL)

Hi Drums – I took that comment to mean that the phrase 'minority' may be one of those intractable labels that aren't questioned or re-considered, even as demographics (religious, ethnic, racial, socioeconomic) shift into new shapes. I.e., at what point is a group allowed to be a solid demographic, and not just relegated to a minority?

I was reminded of this article by The Hill – https://thehill.com/latino/4063595-texas-is-now-a-majority-minority-state/ – "Texas is now a majority-minority state". The first line gives an indication as to what that means – "Hispanics are the largest demographic group in Texas, outnumbering non-Hispanic white people for the first time since the mid-19th century, according to U.S. Census data." By the numbers, Hispanic residents are now the ethnic majority in Texas; so why not call them the majority? Why the label 'majority-minority'? Isn't 'majority' fitting enough? It's a curious thing which brings in themes of intersectional oppression, and, in this case, distinctions drawn by having a federal + state system (Hispanic = nationwide /minority/, despite Texas state /majority/).

(what was the aspect the astrologer was looking at, do  you think? Sun/Saturn? Sun/Uranus?) Also I really appreciated your article on melothesia! So glad you laid out some of the variances in interpretations. I

content_blocks.author: Abigail Joy
content_blocks.text:
I enjoyed the book review.  My mother and I have had lots of conversations about the nature of astrological predictions, precisely along the lines raised by Mr. Little.  How "firm" is astrology?  Can you make predictions with scientific accuracy? Or is there a level of "intuition" (for lack of a better word) that must be added?  I believe it is the latter. Even though astrology has a certain unchangeable quality to it, since the march of the planets is absolute and was set in motion at the beginning of the universe, there is also the fact that any one transit can have dozens of possible interpretations or manifestations. As astrologers, we have to pick the interpretation that we will present to our clients, and that's where there is a certain... leap of faith.

I was called into the world of astrology at the birth of my son, when one of my mothers friends purchased a birth reading for the new baby.  The astrologer made a prediction that today I find rather unethical. At very least, I would certainly never have the courage to make such a prediction.  He said "this child will never be close to his father."  That statement shocked me to my core, because I was secretly contemplating divorcing my then-husband.  There is no way anyone could have known that, and there is no way I could have known that after the divorce my ex would leave the country and abandon us.  He stops by to see the children every few years, if he feels like it, but it's true, my son is not close to his father.  The astrologer's prediction, while dire, was correct!

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: That's a profound story Abigail - thanks for sharing.  Yes, it would be a shocking thing to read -TBH that is one of the reasons I don't like doing natal astrology for clients.  When I was doing that regularly, I realised that most people wanted happy reports and it was a constant dilemma of how to put over what I could read into the chart, or what to mention at all.  I was always perfectly comfortable with 'in person' consultations, but what I like about horary is that I have something specific that someone has asked me to look into.  I don't like the feeling of venturing beyond what I have been tasked with - because how far do we go and when do we stop?  An in person consultation gives you a sense of that, otherwise I would always be inclined to veer on the safe side and "first do no harm".  Kirk's review was certainly a thought-provoking read.

content_blocks.author: Wade Caves
content_blocks.text:
Hi Drums – I took that comment to mean that the phrase 'minority' may be one of those intractable labels that aren't questioned or re-considered, even as demographics (religious, ethnic, racial, socioeconomic) shift into new shapes. I.e., at what point is a group allowed to be a solid demographic, and not just relegated to a minority?

I was reminded of this article by The Hill – https://thehill.com/latino/4063595-texas-is-now-a-majority-minority-state/ – "Texas is now a majority-minority state". The first line gives an indication as to what that means – "Hispanics are the largest demographic group in Texas, outnumbering non-Hispanic white people for the first time since the mid-19th century, according to U.S. Census data." By the numbers, Hispanic residents are now the ethnic majority in Texas; so why not call them the majority? Why the label 'majority-minority'? Isn't 'majority' fitting enough? It's a curious thing which brings in themes of intersectional oppression, and, in this case, distinctions drawn by having a federal + state system (Hispanic = nationwide /minority/, despite Texas state /majority/).

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Well, yes, quite. I don't like the idea of putting irrtetractable labels on anything - or the idea of labelling at all, to be honest (unless it is part of astro-technique and then my Taurean sense of "Tradition ... Tradition ...." kicks in :)). There's just me, and then there is everybody else in the world that is not quite me, so you are all a little strange and take a bit of getting used to.

content_blocks.author: Drums
content_blocks.text: I'm only on the intro & it's already thought provoking! :) I'm wondering who the minorities are that are no longer minorities? The links shared point to the gays. As a very gay gay, that's defo not my experience. There's a difference between a group no longer being a monitory and being co-opted by politicians and the media to appear that way. Curious where you're getting this from?  "These typically concerned the rights of immigrants or ‘minority’ groups (increasingly not so minority),..."

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
Yes, definitely was thinking of gay issues here – suddenly struck with horror at the thought of someone getting the wrong end of the stick there and thinking I might have meant that to apply to immigrants (like, the immigrants are taking over). Since I have spotted a typo on the following page I am going to muse on whether to amend that, to remove all possibility of being misunderstood. I think the UK Government's plans to send immigrants to Nigeria are horrendous and shameful, and that until all nations realise the need to invest in the deeper, underlying issues of sharing world resources more effectively all societies will remain blighted with bigger issues that screw us all anyway (the debilitating effect of war being one of them).  Same with the prison systems, same with our approach to climate issues.  Politics nowadays seems all about making the surface look shiny and getting things to work well on the current shift, without enough thought of the humanity issues and what the next shift has to inherit.
All I meant with the gay issue is - not that minority groups are no longer the minority - but they are less minority than before; increasingly finding their feet as an active normalised part of society. I think that is what Wade is pointing to too. This is quite a contrast to how life was when I was younger – a sense of stigma was very present then so gay people felt constantly concerned with being outed. The story I had in mind was the Christian wedding web designer gaining the right to pick and choose her clients according to their sexual orientation – bizarre situation and an attitude that I hope will simply grow/die out as the younger generations keep gaining strength in freedom of expression to be what they are. Of course, all of this is messy, when alongside that the world stage is still carrying news of homosexuality remaining a very dangerous lifestyle in certain countries.

Skyscript
5 Jul 2023
7

As someone who has been an astrologer for decades yet (shockingly) knows nothing about ‘Esoteric Astrology’ – its framework, history or use in practice – I am really looking forward to this guest talk from Lara this Friday.
A reminder that this event is intended for members of all levels – if you are reading this notice you are cordially invited to this event (and also the Neptunia celebration on 22nd July).
The talk starts at 5:30 pm UTC on Friday 7th July (all local times available on this link).
We will be using the usual Skyscript Zoom link:
Skyscript Zoom link: http://us06web.zoom.us/j/6123333126
- the password (Skyscript) is embedded in the link –
Remember: the Skyscript Zoom link and details of all upcoming events are displayed at the top of the member’s only area at https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php)
Hope to see you Friday,
Thanks Lara!! :)
Deb

title: #9: the Gemini / June issue of the newsletter is out!

content_blocks.text: #9: the Gemini / June issue of the newsletter is out!
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 22 May 2023

content_blocks.text: I know it’s not good to blow one’s trumpet but I’m so grateful to all the super-talented contributors for making this one spectacular. It has everything: research and trivia; current events and ancient history; newly translated classic text, scope of the month ahead, loads of timely charts to explore and diet advice to boot!As usual, I have attached a low resolution copy to this post, but – as ever – my Virgo Moon begs you to remember that the best viewing experience is gained through the high-resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area athttps://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php

I know it’s not good to blow one’s trumpet but I’m so grateful to all the super-talented contributors for making this one spectacular. It has everything: research and trivia; current events and ancient history; newly translated classic text, scope of the month ahead, loads of timely charts to explore and diet advice to boot!

content_blocks.author: Abigail Joy
content_blocks.text:
Powerful issue. All the shenanigans we struggled through while Mercury was retrograde were worth it. :D
The art is breathtaking! That's Morgan's work, correct?

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: I do the layout graphics within the articles but the cover design was fittingly dualistic.  I couldn't get anywhere with my ideas for Gemini, so I asked Morgan to take a look.  He came up with a great concept, which I then adapted a little to complete and incorporate the image of Mercury and some extra effects. Morgan is doing the next one for Cancer - haven't seen it yet, looking forward to that and so grateful for his artistic eye.

content_blocks.text:
Well every newsletter just improves on the previous one and this one is no exception !
what a cracker ! The Prince article was brilliant and I learnt a few things about him too 🤩 thanks Dru and I was very pleased to see the return of Abigail : very informative on the nervous system. As a Virgo with Gemini rising (and the mother of Gemini Twins) this issue was particularly close to my heart (and mind) x

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Oh my - Gemini rising and Gemini Twins :) !

content_blocks.author: Wei
content_blocks.text:
Dear Deb 

I would very much prefer if the exclusive Recordings for Body & Soul members could be preserved as much as possible (I notice that the current retention period is 12 months). I find those topics very interesting, but at the moment, I am unable to subscribe to Body & Soul members. Perhaps you might consider selling expired recordings individually?

This is just my personal wish. How you decide to proceed ultimately depends on your own thoughts and arrangements. 😄❤️

Kind regards

Wei

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: That's great feedback for me to have Wei. I am never in a rush to activate a plan - I tend to give a limit so I can always safely fall on the generous side of it, so I can give more thought to this. I might also find a way later in the year when all mind level subscribers can have a limited period to view (not download) the recordings as part of the plan.  Thanks for taking the toruble to share your thoughts!

full_content:
#9: the Gemini / June issue of the newsletter is out!
Skyscript
22 May 2023
13
12
I know it’s not good to blow one’s trumpet but I’m so grateful to all the super-talented contributors for making this one spectacular. It has everything: research and trivia; current events and ancient history; newly translated classic text, scope of the month ahead, loads of timely charts to explore and diet advice to boot!

As usual, I have attached a low resolution copy to this post, but – as ever – my Virgo Moon begs you to remember that the best viewing experience is gained through the high-resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area at  https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php
Or you can go straight to it in fullscreen here:
https://issuu.com/sta_astrology/docs/skyscript_newsletter_9?fr=sZTgxMDYwNzIwNDk
Do remember to check into the member’s area regularly to see what’s available there.  You can easily access all the past issues, grab a copy of Griffin on Theft, and check the list of upcoming talk dates.
Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password is (all lower case): regio
Thanks again to the contributors – Abigail – Dru – Jason - Joni – and Tanja – and also to Morgan for helping with the design concept of the Gemini logo.
If any of the content stirs you, feel free to use this thread to discuss this issue’s content.
Thanks for your wonderful support!
-  Deb

Australia plans major overhaul of defenses as China rises
A government-commissioned review says Australia needs to spend more money on defense, make its own munitions and develop the ability to strike longer-range targets as China's military buildup challenges regional security. The Defense Strategic Review supports the so-called AUKUS partnership between Australia, United States and Britain and recommends deepening the relationships with other key partners.
https://apnews.com/article/australia-defense-strategic-review-china-be313bcbd58e6793a8c85b79682c0e34

title: An update now I'm finally turning a corner ...

content_blocks.text: An update now I'm finally turning a corner ...
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 22 Apr 2023

content_blocks.text: Hi everyone
content_blocks.html: Hi everyone

content_blocks.text: I just wanted to send a quick note to let everyone know why I’ve been so quiet this last month. In my last message, I mentioned that my husband and I were recovering from some kind of flu-type virus infection –  just as we thought we were getting over the worst of that, we both took ill again and discovered we had covid.  (We had prided ourselves on thinking we had managed to escape that one!)  So it has been a debilitating/frustrating month all round – my husband has been worse than me, but we both seem to be on the road to recovery now.  I am still not quite myself yet; my energy levels (and ability to focus) are still low and I find that after a few hours of work at my desk I crash very suddenly and need to rest.  But every day gets a little better, so I am confident that I will be back to my usual self by the end of next week.
content_blocks.html: I just wanted to send a quick note to let everyone know why I’ve been so quiet this last month. In my last message, I mentioned that my husband and I were recovering from some kind of flu-type virus infection –  just as we thought we were getting over the worst of that, we both took ill again and discovered we had covid.  (We had prided ourselves on thinking we had managed to escape that one!)  So it has been a debilitating/frustrating month all round – my husband has been worse than me, but we both seem to be on the road to recovery now.  I am still not quite myself yet; my energy levels (and ability to focus) are still low and I find that after a few hours of work at my desk I crash very suddenly and need to rest.  But every day gets a little better, so I am confident that I will be back to my usual self by the end of next week.

content_blocks.text: I had expected to announce an extra astrology discussion this month, but since I’ve had a non-functioning brain, I haven’t been able to do that.  I'm sorry about that. As soon as I am firing on all cylinders again I’ll get back on track with everything. For now, the next event I have planned is the talk about Ursa Major and the Pole Stars that I’ll be delivering at 4pm UTC on Saturday 29th April (full details in the member’s area). This will be a formal lecture with shared participation between Wade Cave’s ‘Astronomy for Astrologers’ course students and the Skyscript body/spirit patreons. It gives a good all-round tour of the use of constellations and fixed stars in astrology, with attention directed on the Great Bear as an example of how to understand the symbolic origin of traditionally recorded star meanings.

full_content:
An update now I'm finally turning a corner ...
Skyscript
22 Apr 2023
16
13
Hi everyone
I just wanted to send a quick note to let everyone know why I’ve been so quiet this last month. In my last message, I mentioned that my husband and I were recovering from some kind of flu-type virus infection –  just as we thought we were getting over the worst of that, we both took ill again and discovered we had covid.  (We had prided ourselves on thinking we had managed to escape that one!)  So it has been a debilitating/frustrating month all round – my husband has been worse than me, but we both seem to be on the road to recovery now.  I am still not quite myself yet; my energy levels (and ability to focus) are still low and I find that after a few hours of work at my desk I crash very suddenly and need to rest.  But every day gets a little better, so I am confident that I will be back to my usual self by the end of next week.
I had expected to announce an extra astrology discussion this month, but since I’ve had a non-functioning brain, I haven’t been able to do that.  I'm sorry about that. As soon as I am firing on all cylinders again I’ll get back on track with everything. For now, the next event I have planned is the talk about Ursa Major and the Pole Stars that I’ll be delivering at 4pm UTC on Saturday 29th April (full details in the member’s area). This will be a formal lecture with shared participation between Wade Cave’s ‘Astronomy for Astrologers’ course students and the Skyscript body/spirit patreons. It gives a good all-round tour of the use of constellations and fixed stars in astrology, with attention directed on the Great Bear as an example of how to understand the symbolic origin of traditionally recorded star meanings.
Although I haven’t been able to be very productive lately, I did manage to do some tidy-up and development work on Skyscript, focussing on the ‘text-area’ to remove dead links and add in some new texts that are not otherwise available.  There’s some really valuable and useful texts included in the list, so if you haven’t visited that page in a while, it is definitely worth a visit to check out its latest form. The image below shows just a few of the books that you can read in full by following the links on that page.  if you know of any other good links that I have missed, just let me know and I will add them in.
https://skyscript.co.uk/texts.html
Best to everyone for now!
Deb

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: All that Aries energy I guess - just watching a report on a fire at a deportation centre in US. And the combustion of Jupiter as you say would be like a huge Astrological fire ball !!

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: Will we be expecting more "lawlessness" generally, as Jupiter becomes combust I wonder. I also notice that more and more "Fires" are occurring, and also "Fired" and "Firing" seem to be in the news a lot at the moment, or maybe I am just noticing them more.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Well you had seen it coming and France is now literally on fire 🔥 Nahel’s death was yet another spark on this ongoing period. As you said the Pluto opp Jup/Uranus in the 1789 chart has reignited another ‘revolution’ !!

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Interestingly the chart for the 5th Republique (which would count as the one for the various governments since - 28/09/1958 Paris 6pm) has Uranus at 15° Leo so a nice T-square with Macron's in Scorpio and the current opp to Uranus in Taurus!... also, all current planets are in opposition to the stellium in 7th in the Rep's chart.  It is indeed a true picture of the current deep bipolar division of France, and the revolution feel of the period!

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: The Aries ingress prior to him assuming power in 2017 has a Moon-Saturn conjunction within a degree or two of his Sun-Mercury conjunction.

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: Pluto is currently opposing the Jupiter Uranus conjunction in the chart of the French National Assembly set for Versailles in 1789; in fact Macrons natal chart picks up quite a few of the positions in that chart.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Interesting Joanna   There are a lot of references going on about 1789 at the moment - thank goodness Macron chose to postpone the visit of King Charles as too many reference to royalty already ! It’s already very much « let them eat brioche » at the moment without adding a King into the mix !!

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: You put a big smile on my face this morning by doing that Kerryleegh! If you or anyone is wondering why Issue 8 is on Amazon and why I have made any notice about that - it's because I trialled out the method of Amazon producing a hard copy, just to see what could be done, and how, and what kind of RRP that would produce. At the moment I am not entirely satisfied with their offering - hence I haven't promoted it and I'm in two minds whether to leave that issue up or take that issue off.  But I have learned a lot in the process, for sure.  I'll be getting back to Amazon next week to ask if some hiccups can be overcome.  And I will explain more about the prospect of this to subscribers shortly - as soon as I'm a bit more informed. In the short term I suggest you don't purchase a copy from them - but - your morale boost, really lifts me - thanks!!!

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: My goodness - thank you Mireille!  As you know, I have been laid low this last week with some horrible flu-type virus (feeling a tiny bit perkier today, but stil operating on half-cylinders).  I noticed on Twitter that Abigail has something similar - thinking of you Abigail!  Morgan also tweeted me this week to say he had some kind of flu virus, and I tweeted back to say I have it worse:)  And I think it is only a week or so since Jason had something like this.  I wonder how widespread this is, because everyone around me seems to be 'under the weather' right now.  I personally attribute it to the recent Mars-Saturn trine in the water signs - so very infectious.  Anyway, it seems that all of us could do with a little bright sunshine right now, and for me nothing lifts my spirits more than to know that someone is enjoying the newsletter!

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Another WOW edition !! Where to start ! Abigail’s Mars take was so enlightening and I love her writing style (love the quotes and how patient Mars is - HA!). The Dean/Guinness blew my mind (like Jason I have now read and reread it): the writing is perfect (but then Deb is a natural story teller in my mind ) and the astrology write up is so clear ! As well as the spookiness of the actual astrology. I do love those long articles by Deb (like the Agatha one). Also what I truly enjoy and appreciate in the newsletter is all the extra information in the page on newly found items of interest and also in the footnotes - we get to find new websites, links to other articles on the web,  etc. It is such a mind expanding newsletter in itself but beyond itself too. Thanks for all the hard work Deb & al.  !! It is very much appreciated.

content_blocks.author: ingriper
content_blocks.text: I love Eve's article about timing of horary charts, but makes me even more curious about timing when you cast the chart for your own question, so when astrologer and querent are the same... intuition?

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: I try to resist asking my own questions over little things - so my principle is always this: don't ask the question until I really cannot stop myself - when I am that eager or concerned that it fully occupies my thoughts, it's time to ask the question. If I am two-minded about whether to ask my own question or or not, then that is not the right time :)

title: A new universal time zone (for the Moon)

content_blocks.text: A new universal time zone (for the Moon)
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 4 Mar 2023

content_blocks.text: Jason brought this to my attention last Wednesday, just as the Mercury-Saturn conjunction at the end of Aquarius became exact. The news seemed very aligned with the theme of those two planets: scientists discussing how to measure/calculate time on an inhospitable ancient rock :)
content_blocks.html: Jason brought this to my attention last Wednesday, just as the Mercury-Saturn conjunction at the end of Aquarius became exact. The news seemed very aligned with the theme of those two planets: scientists discussing how to measure/calculate time on an inhospitable ancient rock :)

content_blocks.text: There is a coordinated effort to create a new time zone for the Moon - currently Moon time is set to UTC. But "clocks run faster on the moon than on Earth, gaining about 56 microseconds each day, the space agency said. Further complicating matters, ticking occurs differently on the lunar surface than in lunar orbit."
content_blocks.html: There is a coordinated effort to create a new time zone for the Moon - currently Moon time is set to UTC. But "clocks run faster on the moon than on Earth, gaining about 56 microseconds each day, the space agency said. Further complicating matters, ticking occurs differently on the lunar surface than in lunar orbit."

content_blocks.text: “This will be quite a challenge with each day lasting as long as 29.5 Earth days", Hufenbach said in a statement. “But having established a working time system for the moon, we can go on to do the same for other planetary destinations.”
content_blocks.html: “This will be quite a challenge with each day lasting as long as 29.5 Earth days", Hufenbach said in a statement. “But having established a working time system for the moon, we can go on to do the same for other planetary destinations.”

content_blocks.text: Hmmm.  Note that Jason spoke about interesting developments in science as part of a predominating theme in the last two issues of the newsletter.  What with AI suddenly everywhere and news of developments like this, and increasing prospects of planetary settlement (and UFOS), it is clear there is a rapid pace of progression taking place on many fronts.

4 Mar 2023
8

Jason brought this to my attention last Wednesday, just as the Mercury-Saturn conjunction at the end of Aquarius became exact. The news seemed very aligned with the theme of those two planets: scientists discussing how to measure/calculate time on an inhospitable ancient rock :) 
There is a coordinated effort to create a new time zone for the Moon - currently Moon time is set to UTC. But "clocks run faster on the moon than on Earth, gaining about 56 microseconds each day, the space agency said. Further complicating matters, ticking occurs differently on the lunar surface than in lunar orbit."
“This will be quite a challenge with each day lasting as long as 29.5 Earth days", Hufenbach said in a statement. “But having established a working time system for the moon, we can go on to do the same for other planetary destinations.”
Hmmm.  Note that Jason spoke about interesting developments in science as part of a predominating theme in the last two issues of the newsletter.  What with AI suddenly everywhere and news of developments like this, and increasing prospects of planetary settlement (and UFOS), it is clear there is a rapid pace of progression taking place on many fronts.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Sorry I couldn't get your membership activated in time for that Louise.

content_blocks.author: Gary Cousins
content_blocks.text: What I got most from watching this, besides great scholarly info from Martin, is the wonderful sense of community in this forum. Thank you Deb for all your hard work and resilience in the face of a lot of very immature criticism. Astrology will only gain from this as I believe it is making us all question everything and learning to become more discerning. As Martin said we all need to read as many translations as possible and compare them. Let’s not allow A.I and social media to take over!

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Thanks Gary, and ditto the point about AI and social media :)

content_blocks.author: Theodora Vasilopoulou
content_blocks.text: Hello Deb, I am watching the recording as I couldn't join you last night . For what it's worth, I am Greek and have studied Ancient Greek for 3 years. I do not ever even mention it because it's a very mathematically built language where every syllable has an effect on the meaning and where there were no punctuation marks, so it's pretty easy to misunderstand things (modern Greek has evolved but there is a huge amount of words that remain the same and being a native gives you an advantage). You are so right about the translations including interpretations. As we cannot speak every single language, we should all be very cautious, tolerant and flexible. Much love to you

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Thanks Theodora, great to get your view on this.

content_blocks.author: Emma Gardiner
content_blocks.text: Regarding Martin's comments on the houses and signs as separate charts in Indian astrology, is there anywhere that I can read about this in more detail? If Martin isn't here, I can post this in the Skyscript forum. Thank you again for opening up this topic, it's connected me and I'm sure many others to more information on this than ever before. It's all been and continues to be very illuminating!

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
Martin has an associate membership to Skyscript, which means he gets the newsletters and announcements but doesn't get access to this Patreaon area.  But Skyscript would definitely be the better place for that sort of question anyway. There is a thread that concerns his paper and if you post the question there I am sure he will give an answer as soon as he can (sometimes takes a day or two but he is pretty good at answring all queries about his work).

http://skyscript.co.uk/forums/viewtopic.php?t=11894

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: 😂😂 thanks for a great talk tonight and it was excellent to hear Martin explain his paper / where  he was writing from.  Glad we boosted your spirits- you deserve it all as you boost and have been boosting our learning all these years !! (France is all Saturn Mars - strikes over pension age 😂😂😂

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
It is pretty amazing how many strikes we have going on in Britain right now - haven't seen anything like it since the Thatcher era. And all so resonant to the Mars in Gemini theme: teachers, postal workers, firemen, train drivers, public servants, ambulence drivers  .. just a few that come to mind.  Undermining everything is the issue of inflation.  
The ingress for Paris has Mars ruling the 1st and 6th house, with Mars in Gemini in the 8th house and Jupiter (disposed by that Mars) on the 6th house cusp.  So the idea of workers rights being affected is a major mundane theme for France just as it is for us here in Britain.
