Recording for the Talk about The Houses Talk
Skyscript
24 Feb 2023
13
14
Dear me – that was a bad ‘close down’ from me at the end of the meeting tonight.  I forgot to say ‘thank you’ to Martin!  I have written to make sure he realises how much I (and I’m sure the rest of you) appreciated being able to hear his take on things. His research is so impressive and sincere.
And thank you to everyone for joining this meeting tonight.  I knew I would enjoy it, and I did - it was a big boost for me to see so many friendly faces again after the last couple of ‘testy’ weeks.
I’m open to suggestions on get-together themes for a full tier 'social' sometime around the equinox.  Shall we explore ingresses (with a particular focus on what is going on in France to keep Mireille happy?)  Or ... other ideas?

And, BTW, the talk recording is now available on the member's page too.

Skyscript meeting reminder: today - 6pm UTC 24 Feb
Skyscript
24 Feb 2023
8
2
A reminder about the meeting later today, at 6pm UTC (Friday 24 Feb) – check your local time zone on this link

Let’s TALK about THAT TALK about the HOUSES
Skyscript Zoom link to join the meeting:
http://us06web.zoom.us/j/6123333126 
(password embedded)
I apologise again for the late rescheduling of the theme. I hope you can join me and for those that cannot the meeting will be recorded (for Skyscript members only).
If anyone has a question that you don’t want missed, you can email it to me (or message me through Patreon) and I’ll be sure to answer it even if you cannot attend. I am open to questions of any nature, regarding the content of my talk, research moving forward, or even concerns about dealing with any perceived divisions in the community.
I am really delighted that Martin Gansten will be joining to talk about the findings in his paper: Platikos and moirikos: Ancient Horoscopic Practice in the Light of Vettius Valens’ Anthologies
This is a great opportunity to pick Martin’s brains so if you haven’t read his paper yet it would be a good idea to check it out -  you can get a copy for free from https://doi.org/10.1163/25899201-12340029
I am really looking forward to meeting up later getting back together as a group again!
Deb

title: Issue 7 – March/Pisces ed of the newsletter is out

content_blocks.text: Issue 7 – March/Pisces ed of the newsletter is out
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 23 Feb 2023

content_blocks.text: The latest issue of the newsletter is out!Plenty of good astro-nosh to munch on and lots of timely features too.
content_blocks.html:
The latest issue of the newsletter is out!

Plenty of good astro-nosh to munch on and lots of timely features too.

content_blocks.text: The mostimportant and urgent piece of news(detailed on p.5) is this:
content_blocks.html: The most important and urgent piece of news (detailed on p.5) is this:

content_blocks.text: I have changed the talk theme for tomorrow’s Skyscript meet-up, and the original talk-theme ‘Odds on Astrology’ has been moved to 13th March (see the notice on p.4)
content_blocks.html: I have changed the talk theme for tomorrow’s Skyscript meet-up, and the original talk-theme ‘Odds on Astrology’ has been moved to 13th March (see the notice on p.4)

content_blocks.text: I’m really sorry to make such a big change at such short notice, but with all that has gone on concerning my houses talk over the last few weeks I really want to use tomorrow’smeeting as a chance to fully resolve any questions or queries that any of you might have about that. And also look at what new research is coming to light on that issue.I am open to any and every question anyone might have on this topic (hit me with anything), and also open to your suggestions. I will also be joined by Martin Gansten, who will be happy to take questions and talk about his more scholarly research too.  I think it will be a great meeting and hope you can join me tomorrow for what I expect to be a very lively and friendly chat.  The details are in the newsletter and I will circulate a reminder tomorrow with the usual Zoom link, etc.
content_blocks.html:
I’m really sorry to make such a big change at such short notice, but with all that has gone on concerning my houses talk over the last few weeks I really want to use tomorrow’smeeting as a chance to fully resolve any questions or queries that any of you might have about that. And also look at what new research is coming to light on that issue.
I am open to any and every question anyone might have on this topic (hit me with anything), and also open to your suggestions. I will also be joined by Martin Gansten, who will be happy to take questions and talk about his more scholarly research too.  I think it will be a great meeting and hope you can join me tomorrow for what I expect to be a very lively and friendly chat.  The details are in the newsletter and I will circulate a reminder tomorrow with the usual Zoom link, etc.

full_content:
Issue 7 – March/Pisces ed of the newsletter is out
Skyscript
23 Feb 2023
14
9

The latest issue of the newsletter is out!

Plenty of good astro-nosh to munch on and lots of timely features too.
The most important and urgent piece of news (detailed on p.5) is this:
I have changed the talk theme for tomorrow’s Skyscript meet-up, and the original talk-theme ‘Odds on Astrology’ has been moved to 13th March (see the notice on p.4)
I’m really sorry to make such a big change at such short notice, but with all that has gone on concerning my houses talk over the last few weeks I really want to use tomorrow’smeeting as a chance to fully resolve any questions or queries that any of you might have about that. And also look at what new research is coming to light on that issue.
I am open to any and every question anyone might have on this topic (hit me with anything), and also open to your suggestions. I will also be joined by Martin Gansten, who will be happy to take questions and talk about his more scholarly research too.  I think it will be a great meeting and hope you can join me tomorrow for what I expect to be a very lively and friendly chat.  The details are in the newsletter and I will circulate a reminder tomorrow with the usual Zoom link, etc.

The meeting will start at: 6 pm UTC – Friday, 24th February 2023 [check other local times on this link]


As usual, I have attached a low resolution copy of the newsletter to this post, but the best viewing experience is definitely gained through the high resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area at  https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php
Remember:  Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password to access the member's area is (all lower case): regio
-----
Big thanks again to the contributors who helped to make this possible – more specifically mentioned within the issue. Remember, we LOVE to get comments, feedback, suggestions – even criticisms (a little bit) as evidence to us that our thoughts are drifiting through to yours and circulating around :)
Hope you enjoy it -  and hope to see some of you tomorrow!

Thank you SO MUCH for the support you have all given me lately!
Deb

(PS – I am making tomorrow’s meeting open to patreons of all levels; the original talk theme – now moved to 13th March is for body and soul members only).

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: "The ages of the participants ranged between 20-89, with the predominance aged 40-59 years, born between 1982-1963. These ‘latchkey kids’ are the last generation to be born with one foot in the analogue world and one in the digital. Due to lowered birth rates in these years, there are fewer people on the planet in this age range, yet this demographic showed up more than any other". This statement really stood out for me... this generation is standing with one foot in the old world and a foot in the new... apparently, this gives us superpowers because our brains have had to develop in two different modes... I say this tongue-in-cheek, but it could be relevant. Those superpowers could come in handy. :)

content_blocks.text: Agreed!

title: If you have not had a message from me you should have!

content_blocks.text: If you have not had a message from me you should have!
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 26 Jan 2023

content_blocks.text: I've just realised that not everyone is getting the personal messages that Ialwayssend out to new Skyscript members. This message gives a welcome from me and explains how to access all the resources, and what your password is, etc.
content_blocks.html: I've just realised that not everyone is getting the personal messages that I always send out to new Skyscript members. This message gives a welcome from me and explains how to access all the resources, and what your password is, etc.

content_blocks.text: I make sure I message everyone as soon as I can - always within 24 hours of joining us.  If anyone has not received a copy of that message by email, perhaps check you are not missing any important info by logging into Patreon (it could be that email copy of the message went to your email spam folder, but it will still be visible to you in the messages area of the Patreon site).I would be interested to know who didn't get this welcome message - because if the problem is affecting many people, I will give up on the message area and email directly instead.

Skyscript
26 Jan 2023
5

I've just realised that not everyone is getting the personal messages that I always send out to new Skyscript members. This message gives a welcome from me and explains how to access all the resources, and what your password is, etc.
I make sure I message everyone as soon as I can - always within 24 hours of joining us.  If anyone has not received a copy of that message by email, perhaps check you are not missing any important info by logging into Patreon (it could be that email copy of the message went to your email spam folder, but it will still be visible to you in the messages area of the Patreon site).

I would be interested to know who didn't get this welcome message - because if the problem is affecting many people, I will give up on the message area and email directly instead.
Apologies, thanks and best wishes ! :)
Deb

full_content:
The February - Aquarius Skyscript newsletter
Skyscript
24 Jan 2023
13
12
The latest issue of the newsletter is out!

Well, this one has felt like a push, but those of you that read it diligently will realise I had a lot of fun with it :)

Lots of good content from lots of different angles, to suit your fluctating moods.

I've included news within the newsletter (p.4) about the next Skyscript Zoom event, and will post a follow-up notice about that later.

As usual, I have attached a low resolution copy to this post, but the best viewing experience is gained through the high resolution issue you can view as a flipbook or PDF, or download, from the members area at  https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php
Remember:  Your username is the email address that you use for this Patreon account
The password is (all lower case): regio
Big thanks to the contributors - Morgan, Wade, Jason and Zoi - and to everyone here for being an audience to a performance that wants to go on show.

I LOVE to get comments, feedback and suggestions - or any kind of evidence that there is someone out there reading this stuff!
Hope you enjoy it -  Deb

title: Homepage updated!

content_blocks.text: Homepage updated!
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 14 Jan 2023

content_blocks.text: I finally got the Skyscript homepage updated - this turned out to be a lot more work than I expected it to be, so it feels great to tick off this task.I already see areas I know can be improved as the site develops and evolves, but for now I am very happy with the new look and there is some great content on it - I hope you can take a moment to check it out and click around.  (I think the lunations section is particularly helpful - be sure to hover over all the links so you can sea how easy it is to get a broad view of all the year's main astrological themes at a glance).

full_content:
Homepage updated!
Skyscript
14 Jan 2023
18
12
I finally got the Skyscript homepage updated - this turned out to be a lot more work than I expected it to be, so it feels great to tick off this task.  

I already see areas I know can be improved as the site develops and evolves, but for now I am very happy with the new look and there is some great content on it - I hope you can take a moment to check it out and click around.  (I think the lunations section is particularly helpful - be sure to hover over all the links so you can sea how easy it is to get a broad view of all the year's main astrological themes at a glance).
I will be creating an acknowledgments page to act as a permanent record for everyone who has contributed in some level to the new developments.  For now, I have mentioned a few names, and I will be sure to mention all patreons over time.

After a marathon stint at the computer to get that uploaded before the weekend begins, I will be offline now until Monday. If anyone has any suggestions or discovers any problems with the new page layout, be sure to let me know!
Have a great weekend!
Deb

title: Suggestions here

content_blocks.text: Suggestions here
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 23 Dec 2022

content_blocks.text: Happily, I discovered this morning that at least Joanna Grant is as daft as I am.  She made herself late for work, composing a suggestion for the last three verses of our ditty.  I love her third (and final) verse, but I still think improvements can be made on the prior two.  So I’m creating a new thread in case anyone wants to post suggestions over the Xmas period – it is surprising what a little Christmas ‘cheer’ does for melodic compositions of a semi-insane nature :)Post away suggestions:
content_blocks.html:
Happily, I discovered this morning that at least Joanna Grant is as daft as I am.  She made herself late for work, composing a suggestion for the last three verses of our ditty.  I love her third (and final) verse, but I still think improvements can be made on the prior two.  So I’m creating a new thread in case anyone wants to post suggestions over the Xmas period – it is surprising what a little Christmas ‘cheer’ does for melodic compositions of a semi-insane nature :)

Post away suggestions:

content_blocks.text: Even if you only feel inspired to post a line or two
That may be all we need to bring the whole thing into better view ….

I’ll pick through the best of any submitted proposals at the end of the month to complete, and put an end to my earworm agony!Here's Joanna’s suggestion for the last three verses - can you do better?------When I can learn exactly what is meant by shadow periodsWhen I can tell the difference twixt Moraya and MorineanWhen I can open Lions Gate and all portals preposterousAnd when I know precisely all the measures of ManiliusWhen I can get to grips with all the terms of pop astrologersAnd have as big a fan base as Wade in Brooklyn MessengerIn short, when I can master anaretic hypotheticalsYou’ll say a better modern astrologer had never come till now.As for my library of knowledge, (even though I’m getting on a bit!)It’s certainly not finished, and I really see no end to itBut still in matters Ancient, Renaissance, Greek and ClassicalI’m at the very forefront of the  modern-day astrologers
content_blocks.html:
I’ll pick through the best of any submitted proposals at the end of the month to complete, and put an end to my earworm agony!

Here's Joanna’s suggestion for the last three verses - can you do better?

------

When I can learn exactly what is meant by shadow periods   
When I can tell the difference twixt Moraya and Morinean
When I can open Lions Gate and all portals preposterous     
And when I know precisely all the measures of Manilius    

When I can get to grips with all the terms of pop astrologers  
And have as big a fan base as Wade in Brooklyn Messenger
In short, when I can master anaretic hypotheticals   
You’ll say a better modern astrologer had never come till now.    

As for my library of knowledge, (even though I’m getting on a bit!)
It’s certainly not finished, and I really see no end to it
But still in matters Ancient, Renaissance, Greek and Classical   
I’m at the very forefront of the  modern-day astrologers

content_blocks.author: Kerryleegh
content_blocks.text:
Deb, Thanks for the invite to play! 
                                ✨  ☃️✨

I’ve befriended the planets as bearers of light & energy 
Delivering clients messages of astrological alchemy
Interpreting rules & patterns may bring about delight 
But the addition of dignity will signify the might.

My curious mind a fortunate friend foresees in direction 
A witness to the aspects & orbs in the consultation 
Nature’s rhythms can be neither cheated nor avoided 
By embracing inspiration, clarity is awarded.

To my credit I’ll admit, this creative field I have chosen 
Unifies the ages where knowledge flows, not frozen
I realize that the cosmos in its infinite wisdom & design 
Every chart is left to posterity, that's including mine. 

… this is the very model of a modern-day astrologer

content_blocks.author: Skyscript

content_blocks.author: Abigail Joy
content_blocks.text:
Oh, this is so funny!  I love musical theatre, and this song has always been a fave.
In the original, the last few stanzas seem to say that the Modern General knows everything about everything... except what was discovered in the most recent century.  Maybe we could play on this and bring in some of the new-fangled terms, like asteroids, centaurs, harmonics... Even Uranus Neptune and Pluto would count, no?  
Need to brain on this a bit...!

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: That is a great idea - yes, definitely good to follow the drift of the original - that are some new things that he hasn't fully figured out, and knowing those will be the key to knowing it all.

full_content:
Suggestions here
Skyscript
23 Dec 2022
5
7
Happily, I discovered this morning that at least Joanna Grant is as daft as I am.  She made herself late for work, composing a suggestion for the last three verses of our ditty.  I love her third (and final) verse, but I still think improvements can be made on the prior two.  So I’m creating a new thread in case anyone wants to post suggestions over the Xmas period – it is surprising what a little Christmas ‘cheer’ does for melodic compositions of a semi-insane nature :)

Post away suggestions:
Even if you only feel inspired to post a line or two
That may be all we need to bring the whole thing into better view ….

I’ll pick through the best of any submitted proposals at the end of the month to complete, and put an end to my earworm agony!

Here's Joanna’s suggestion for the last three verses - can you do better?

------

When I can learn exactly what is meant by shadow periods   
When I can tell the difference twixt Moraya and Morinean
When I can open Lions Gate and all portals preposterous     
And when I know precisely all the measures of Manilius    

When I can get to grips with all the terms of pop astrologers  
And have as big a fan base as Wade in Brooklyn Messenger
In short, when I can master anaretic hypotheticals   
You’ll say a better modern astrologer had never come till now.    

As for my library of knowledge, (even though I’m getting on a bit!)
It’s certainly not finished, and I really see no end to it
But still in matters Ancient, Renaissance, Greek and Classical   
I’m at the very forefront of the  modern-day astrologers  

But still in matters Ancient, Renaissance, Greek and Classical   
She’s at the very forefront of the modern-day astrologers.

content_blocks.author: Emma Gardiner
content_blocks.text: Fascinating article on the V sign - I knew the story in parts, but not the details! I haven't read all of the newsletter yet, but was this article inspired by the V shaped Capricorn glyph? Another point to Saturn...

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
I don’t know if that was on Dylan’s mind when he wrote the piece but it’s a fascinating detail to consider.  As I spent a lot of time thinking about Capricorn last month, and musing on its historical goat-fish symbolism, I kept marvelling at how its strange glyph capture the details of the V in its constellation shape with the addition of horns and a curved fishtail.

It’s a very V-shaped constellation – this image here is not technically correct but conveys the gist of it - https://www.pinterest.co.uk/pin/481955597628455414/

The constellation has a couple of notable stars around the horns – then it a arrows down to a collection of notable ones around the belly, then arrows up again to  the notable ones in the tail – so as I see the glyph, we are depicting the horn stars, then making a V down to the belly and up again to the tail, and finishing that off with the swirly fish tail (note that in historical symbolism the tail is never straight like a fish, it is always curved around or knotted like a serpent).

But I think the Saturn angle for me was the reference to the yew tree – I have always been fascinated by that because in Britain and Europe there is a really rich history of yew trees having an association with ghosts, churchyards, spirits of the dead.  Some say they were planted around graves so that their roots would constrain the spirits of the dead, others that is was because they are such strong, enduring (slow-growing but long-lasting) trees that they offer the best protection from winds and storms. I’m sure I wrote about this myself years back in an article I’ve now lost, but there is a nice article online about its mythology here - https://treesforlife.org.uk/into-the-forest/trees-plants-animals/trees/yew/

“Drooping branches of old yew trees can root and form new trunks where they touch the ground. Thus the yew came to symbolise death and resurrection in Celtic culture.” – perfect for a solstice theme !

On loneliness. The lyrics to ‘Being Alive’ from the musical ‘Company’ by Stephen Sondheim, owner of a Capricorn Moon, exquisitely capture the agony of Capricorn isolation.

First three verses below, followed by a link to a performance of the whole song by Bernadette Peters.

Someone to hold you too close
Someone to hurt you too deep
Someone to sit in your chair
And ruin your sleep

Someone to need you too much
Someone to know you too well
Someone to pull you up short
To put you through hell

Someone you have to let in
Someone whose feelings you spare
Someone who, like it or not
Will want you to share
A little a lot

content_blocks.text: Thanks x

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text:
On second Saturn returns. Brad Pitt has recently emerged from his second Saturn return which is a big deal for him as Saturn at 19° Aquarius is his chart’s ultimate dispositor. 

He has Moon, Mercury, Venus and Mars in Capricorn. Saturn rules his 2nd and 3rd houses. Under December’s Full Moon in Gemini, straddling his Sagittarius-Gemini Asc-Des axis, the front page of the FT Weekend announced that Pitt’s independent production company, Plan B (how Capricorn a name is that!) was acquired by France’s Mediawan for more than $300mn. Pitt will be paid half in shares and half in cash. 

This deal speaks to Pitt’s maturity as a businessman and a creative. Mediawan’s chief executive describes the Oscar-winning Plan B as ‘the best independent producer in the US, so I wouldn’t have wanted anything else to help us grow’. After making it big as a leading Hollywood sex symbol, Pitt began producing films inspired by his own artistic vision and ambition. He’s embodying the Capricorn goat-fish and now it’s paying off big time for him.

Compare pictures of how Pitt looked in his heyday and how he scrubs up now. He looks very much at ease in his casual yet expensive attire, and long hair: he’s a Sagittarian. Capricorn is the most embodied of the earth signs. The second Saturn return enables Pitt to look even more comfortable in his skin than he already naturally is. Previously, he was a relatively clean cut, conventional Capricorn heartthrob.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
I didn't realise how strongly Capricornian he is - thanks for pointing out how dominant that stellium in Capricorn is. I agree with you that he has matured very well.  He had that horrible period around the time of the divorce from Jolie in late 2016, and at that time Saturn was passing over his natal Sun in Sagittarius - probably one of his lowest points.  Then a lot of "inner work' as Saturn passed over all those planets in Capricorn.  Now that it has completed its second return it seems he has got his act together.  Interesting to know about his business side - set for a Jupiter return in the next couple of months too.

https://www.astro.com/astro-databank/Pitt,_Brad

Here is the recording of tonight's meeting, which is also available in the member's section on Skyscript - https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.html

I really enjoyed this get-together - thanks to everyone who connected and shared your enthusiam and thoughts. Really great to see you and keep in touch as we explored the more heavier aspects of Saturn and Capricorn (with a dash of merriment here and there).  I thoroughly enjoyed reading the comments in the chat box afterwards - here's a few that are too good not to immortalise:

From Theodora Vasilopoulou to Everyone:
"« Anyone who wants to be first must be the very last, and the servant of all » it takes a lot of Saturn lessons to fully understand that."

From Jason to Everyone:
"I work outside- every change seasonally, is palpable, if you're there for it"
(Jason also shared that some Capricorns have 6 fingers ;))

From West McDonough to Everyone:
"As Death says in Sandman: « You get what everyone gets: you get a lifetime”

And last (but not least):

From Sheila Roher to Everyone:
"happy (Saturnnalia) holidays to all!"

- I second that, wholeheartedly!

Dx

content_blocks.html: 5 Dec 2022

content_blocks.text: Hi everyone
content_blocks.html: Hi everyone

content_blocks.text: I just want to let everyone know that I will be away from home this week and I won’t be checking email again until after next weekend. If any messages are placed here or sent to me by email, expect a delay and I’ll catch up when I can.
content_blocks.html: I just want to let everyone know that I will be away from home this week and I won’t be checking email again until after next weekend. If any messages are placed here or sent to me by email, expect a delay and I’ll catch up when I can.

content_blocks.text: I am leaving on an early morning flight to visit my mum who lives in the Canary Isles – I haven’t seen her in person since before the Covid outbreak, so this is a very long-overdue family trip. I know she will be thrilled to see me and vice-versa.(I'm attaching one of my favourite photos of me with my mum and dad in 2010, shortly before dad died of a heart attack, even though he looked so full of health. I was blessed in life with a pair of wonderful parents).Best to allDeb x

Skyscript
5 Dec 2022
20

Hi everyone
I just want to let everyone know that I will be away from home this week and I won’t be checking email again until after next weekend. If any messages are placed here or sent to me by email, expect a delay and I’ll catch up when I can.
I am leaving on an early morning flight to visit my mum who lives in the Canary Isles – I haven’t seen her in person since before the Covid outbreak, so this is a very long-overdue family trip. I know she will be thrilled to see me and vice-versa.

(I'm attaching one of my favourite photos of me with my mum and dad in 2010, shortly before dad died of a heart attack, even though he looked so full of health. I was blessed in life with a pair of wonderful parents).

Best to all
Deb x

full_content:
December promotion - associate membership
Skyscript
1 Dec 2022

December is here already! With the upcoming festive period in mind, some of you may be interested in the one-month promotion I am running until the end of the year.
For a heavily discounted cost of £13 (fully inclusive - no extra VAT!), you can add a 12-month associate membership to your account, which allows you to gift the benefits of your membership to a friend for a one-year period.

Your friend will have their own independent Skyscript account by which they can log in to the members' area and access all the newsletters, resources and recordings available there. They will also receive news of important events, be emailed copies of the newsletters and major resources as they are published, and they can attend any of the talks and presentations that your own membership allows.
What happens if you cancel your own subscription to Patreon?

Not a problem – purchasing an associate membership during December 2022 gives your friend a guaranteed 12-month membership and access to the resources, even if you cancel your own account. This is designed to allow you to ‘gift’ this membership during the festive season – there are no strings attached and this is not in any way dependent on you maintaining a subscription of your own.
As the recipient of the gift, your friend will be sent a beautifully designed solstice card by email, to make them aware of your gift and how to access the resources (you will be Bcc-d into this email so you can see that it has been delivered). Great care will be taken to ensure that any associate memberships purchased close to Christmas are delivered ahead of Santa!

If you are interested, check out the details at:
https://www.skyscript.co.uk/am1.php 
Where you can see the design of the email that will be sent to your friend, and go ahead and add this extra to your account very easily.
(Limited to 1 associate membership per account; offer ends 31/12/2022). I'd love to get thoughts and feedback on this idea, and if you have any questions, ask away!

Deb

I’m posting early details here of the next two Zoom events – reminders for each will also be circulated later, nearer the time.
The first, on 19th December 2022, is designed to be more of a festive social gathering, inviting members of all tiers to join together and generate group thoughts on solstice astro-themes.
The second, on January 8th 2023, is the next meeting for body and soul members. This pursues a deep exploration of the astrological principles embedded in the elected foundation chart for Baghdad.
Details of both events are also added to the member's page on Skyscript (www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php) and, of course, both events will be recorded for those unable to attend who want to catch the discussion later.
Hope you like the ideas presented - I am personally looking forward to both of these!
Best for now
Deb

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
Yes, you can - the following steps explain how to switch over your pledge to annual:

 1) Log in, hover over your profile icon in the top-right corner and select Manage  Memberships
2)  From your Active Memberships page, click Edit next to the pledge you want to change
 Select the Annual option (if available) on the checkout page
3)  Click the Update button. You’ll be charged up-front for the discounted price

Patreon has also provided this help centre article if you have any questions about how it works - https://support.patreon.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042152671

content_blocks.text: It is good you mentioned it Gary, because I want everyone to be fully aware of all costs.  I tend to think about the monthly charge only - because that is all I am informed about. It actually came as a shock to me, when I set this account up in July, to realise that people get charged more than the advertised subscription price because of the VAT (value added tax). Annoying! ... unless it helps you to realise you are supporting the British tax system too, and, no, I don't suppose it does (!)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
Hi Gary - firstly, thanks for the show of support which is very appreciated.  I got a message through the system saying that you had edited your 2nd tier pledge from £15 per month to £162.01 per year.  Now why they have added that extra penny I do not know - 12 x 15 is £180, minus 10% is £18, so that means the one-year subscription with the 10% discount is £162. So this seems correct except for a stray penny.
Remember this is British pounds which will be converted to your own currency - and also remember that VAT is added to the charge, which I wish I could avoid, but can't. But I presume the system explains that.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Do let me know if you are happy with that - if not, message me privately and I'll see if there is a way to reverse the payment. Dx

full_content:
Skyscript patrons - pledge annually and save!
Skyscript
27 Nov 2022
6
10

Hi everyone,
In the last skyscript discussion, I learned that some of you would prefer to pay for an annual subscription rather than a monthly subscription.

I have now set the system up so that you can do that - I have set a discount of 10% for anyone willing to commit to a full year of patreon support, because, in addition to reducing transaction fees, this helps me create quality content with a reassured mind and reduces the chance of problems created by credit cards declining. 
The following steps explain how to switch over your pledge to annual:
Log in, hover over your profile icon in the top-right corner and select Manage  Memberships
From your Active Memberships page, click Edit next to the pledge you want to change
Select the Annual option (if available) on the checkout page
Click the Update button. You’ll be charged up-front for the discounted price
Patreon has also provided this help centre article if you have any questions about how it works.
Thanks for giving me your feedback on this!
Deb

content_blocks.author: Lara van Zuydam
content_blocks.text: Just to say that this text is incredibly helpful. I used it for the first time yesterday in a suspected theft scenario. Fortunately, the querent was simply confused and the money that he suspected had been stolen was found - in a different jacket pocket..! My two main (and perhaps obvious) takeaways from applying  the criteria for theft (p. 7) are as follows: (i) separation from a modern planet is not a separation for the purposes of the first criterion ("If the lord of the house of the Moon, or lord of the second do separate from any planet, it is stolen"); (ii) 7 degrees is too wide an orb to qualify as a square between the suspect and the querent.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
I'm really pleased you found that text useful Lara - it is not an "easy read" for someone who has no need to worry about that theme, but it is a great study text to have for that subject.  It is also available as a paperback on Amazon BTW, but I haven't promoted any news of that yet because I am waiting to receive and check the proof copy first. 
I agree that when an aspect has passed an orb of 7° it's effects have become quite weak.  Glad your querent found the missing money in the end!

content_blocks.author: B
content_blocks.text:
This is really nice of you and exciting. 
Thank you so much.

An extra provision for members
Skyscript
22 Nov 2022
16
6

Since there is no Skyscript newsletter this month, I am circulating a free digital edition of an astro-text that has been newly released on ISSUU today - my retyped and annotated edition of Anthony Griffin's 'Astrological Judgment Touching Theft'.

Remember, the best way to access all Patreon resources in one place is to login to the members-only area on Skyscript at:

https://www.skyscript.co.uk/patron/news.php 
Your username will be your email address and the generic password is regio

This publication can be read as a flipbook from that page (it is located in the 'past issues' section).
You can also add to your personal Issuu library by using the voucher code to avoid the usual charge of £8.75 + VAT. I have also attached a copy to this post so you receive it by email too!

I did most of the work on this text over 10 years ago, but apart from a handful of private horary students, who received it between 2012-2014 as part of their coursework, it has never been made publicly available before today. It is definitely an interesting text to read - be sure to check out the appendices at the end of the book, where I add some thoughts on why I suspect Lilly could have been the author, writing under a pseudonym, and add some extra historical charts on this theme.

Hopefully, this will give you all something interesting to peruse until the newsletter circulation is resumed next month.
Deb

title: Eclipse makeover

content_blocks.text: Eclipse makeover
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 7 Nov 2022

content_blocks.text: I've spent most of my time between the two eclipses working over the eclipse material on Skyscript (so I am pretty informed on eclipses now – ask me anything, LOL – but get in before March 2025, because I think the cosmos copied out my natal chart for that one!).
content_blocks.html: I've spent most of my time between the two eclipses working over the eclipse material on Skyscript (so I am pretty informed on eclipses now – ask me anything, LOL – but get in before March 2025, because I think the cosmos copied out my natal chart for that one!).

content_blocks.text: If you haven’t visited that section for a while, it is worth taking a look at the resources available.  All of the following pages include cross-links to related material, so you can browse through the whole section easily:
content_blocks.html: If you haven’t visited that section for a while, it is worth taking a look at the resources available.  All of the following pages include cross-links to related material, so you can browse through the whole section easily:

content_blocks.text: Eclipse Data & Charts-https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipse.html
Useful starting point: includes information on all eclipses up to 2030, and the entries up to the end of 2025 include links to view the chart of the eclipse.
Darkening of the Light -https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipses.html

David Plant’s introductory article to the mechanics and descriptive terms associated with eclipses.  Every astrologer should read through this at least once – because everyone should know at least this much.
Traditional Rules for Judging Eclipses-https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipserules.html
Outlines the main principles to consider in judgement, with details on each of the planets as eclipse rulers, and the effects altered according to constellations and signs.

There is also a passage on timing included (advice from Charles Carter) and two great articles by Dennis Elwell.  I particularly like some points Elwell made in his article on theKing’s Cross eclipse– he was one of the first modern authors I noticed who stressed the importance of finding repeat patterns and focusing on radical connections to root charts in mundane work.
content_blocks.html: There is also a passage on timing included (advice from Charles Carter) and two great articles by Dennis Elwell.  I particularly like some points Elwell made in his article on the King’s Cross eclipse – he was one of the first modern authors I noticed who stressed the importance of finding repeat patterns and focusing on radical connections to root charts in mundane work.

full_content:
Eclipse makeover
Skyscript
7 Nov 2022
19
6

I've spent most of my time between the two eclipses working over the eclipse material on Skyscript (so I am pretty informed on eclipses now – ask me anything, LOL – but get in before March 2025, because I think the cosmos copied out my natal chart for that one!).
If you haven’t visited that section for a while, it is worth taking a look at the resources available.  All of the following pages include cross-links to related material, so you can browse through the whole section easily:

Eclipse Data & Charts - https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipse.html
Useful starting point: includes information on all eclipses up to 2030, and the entries up to the end of 2025 include links to view the chart of the eclipse.

Darkening of the Light -https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipses.html
David Plant’s introductory article to the mechanics and descriptive terms associated with eclipses.  Every astrologer should read through this at least once – because everyone should know at least this much.

Traditional Rules for Judging Eclipses - https://www.skyscript.co.uk/eclipserules.html
Outlines the main principles to consider in judgement, with details on each of the planets as eclipse rulers, and the effects altered according to constellations and signs.

There is also a passage on timing included (advice from Charles Carter) and two great articles by Dennis Elwell.  I particularly like some points Elwell made in his article on the King’s Cross eclipse – he was one of the first modern authors I noticed who stressed the importance of finding repeat patterns and focusing on radical connections to root charts in mundane work.
https://www.skyscript.co.uk/kingscross.html
The section is in good shape now, so I’ll leave it at that for now, and continue to add helpful material on a regular basis as new eclipses come round.

title: Just a thank you - from me to you :)

content_blocks.text: Just a thank you - from me to you :)
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 27 Oct 2022

content_blocks.text: I know I have said this before (and maybe irritatingly so), but I really do want to thank each and every one of you for supporting this project, and I want to give you my assurance that every penny raised through the Patreon project goes towards the development of Skyscript – and will not pay for private holidays to Seychelles or anything like that! Without your support, I would not be able to do the thing in life that I love the most – which is to spend time making Skyscript a really beautiful and worthwhile website to visit. I am paying myself an hourly rate at the UK living wage rate, and using funds raised to pay other contributors at the national average wage – knowing that every one of them is contributing for the love of the art, and not for money. The situation being new, things are still borderline between funds raised and expenses incurred, so every one of you is a precious resource in allowing me to proceed with the plan I want to develop – and I am so grateful for the support you are giving me. (I am wondering whether to make budget details available to Patreons – if I do, it will be an annual thing, to keep demands on my time low).

Without your support, I would not be able to do the thing in life that I love the most – which is to spend time making Skyscript a really beautiful and worthwhile website to visit. I am paying myself an hourly rate at the UK living wage rate, and using funds raised to pay other contributors at the national average wage – knowing that every one of them is contributing for the love of the art, and not for money. The situation being new, things are still borderline between funds raised and expenses incurred, so every one of you is a precious resource in allowing me to proceed with the plan I want to develop – and I am so grateful for the support you are giving me. (I am wondering whether to make budget details available to Patreons – if I do, it will be an annual thing, to keep demands on my time low).

content_blocks.text: I want to give a special ‘thank you’ to my soul-level supporters who are really making a huge difference in keeping things afloat.  I am very aware that I have not given you much by way of added benefits to justify your extra expense, but hope to rectify that shortly – bear with me for now (the last couple of months have been *very* busy, but things are starting to normalise - which feels great!).

content_blocks.text: Whatever your level of support, I really do thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

full_content:
Just a thank you - from me to you :)
Skyscript
27 Oct 2022
27
9
I know I have said this before (and maybe irritatingly so), but I really do want to thank each and every one of you for supporting this project, and I want to give you my assurance that every penny raised through the Patreon project goes towards the development of Skyscript – and will not pay for private holidays to Seychelles or anything like that! Without your support, I would not be able to do the thing in life that I love the most – which is to spend time making Skyscript a really beautiful and worthwhile website to visit. I am paying myself an hourly rate at the UK living wage rate, and using funds raised to pay other contributors at the national average wage – knowing that every one of them is contributing for the love of the art, and not for money. The situation being new, things are still borderline between funds raised and expenses incurred, so every one of you is a precious resource in allowing me to proceed with the plan I want to develop – and I am so grateful for the support you are giving me. (I am wondering whether to make budget details available to Patreons – if I do, it will be an annual thing, to keep demands on my time low).
I want to give a special ‘thank you’ to my soul-level supporters who are really making a huge difference in keeping things afloat.  I am very aware that I have not given you much by way of added benefits to justify your extra expense, but hope to rectify that shortly – bear with me for now (the last couple of months have been *very* busy, but things are starting to normalise - which feels great!).
Whatever your level of support, I really do thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

And probably everyone would agree with me that your time is better spent on, well, astrology! Thank you for all you do! :)

title: Oscar Wilde - born on this date in 1854

content_blocks.text: Oscar Wilde - born on this date in 1854
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 16 Oct 2022

content_blocks.text: I just shared this personal story on Facebook, and because some of you are not on Social Media I want to share this with my close colleagues here as well.
content_blocks.html: I just shared this personal story on Facebook, and because some of you are not on Social Media I want to share this with my close colleagues here as well.

content_blocks.text: It ties to some of my recent chart update work I did for Skyscript -  specifically the natal chart of Oscar Wilde who is having his solar return today - some notes on his birth chart are here:https://www.skyscript.co.uk/libracharts.html#ow
content_blocks.html: It ties to some of my recent chart update work I did for Skyscript -  specifically the natal chart of Oscar Wilde who is having his solar return today - some notes on his birth chart are here: https://www.skyscript.co.uk/libracharts.html#ow

content_blocks.text: I have always been a fan of Wilde's work and a few weeks ago, when I was creating this graphic for this chart, I had a strange and uplifting experience.
content_blocks.html: I have always been a fan of Wilde's work and a few weeks ago, when I was creating this graphic for this chart, I had a strange and uplifting experience.

content_blocks.text: Just at the point where I needed to find a graphic for his face I became very tired, very suddenly, and decided to take a nap. I slept heavily, for longer than expected, then got back to work with no recollection of whatever it was I had dreamed about.
content_blocks.html: Just at the point where I needed to find a graphic for his face I became very tired, very suddenly, and decided to take a nap. I slept heavily, for longer than expected, then got back to work with no recollection of whatever it was I had dreamed about.

content_blocks.text: As I resumed work and found this image I became fascinated as I worked on it, like his eyes were really staring at me - I wondered why his finger seemed to be pointing to his mind, and then I lost myself in my imagination for a while exploring the detail of the eyes, the tie, the coat and the ring - captured by the elegance of it all. Then, in a flash, my entire dream came back to me in vivid detail - and woah what a dream.
content_blocks.html: As I resumed work and found this image I became fascinated as I worked on it, like his eyes were really staring at me - I wondered why his finger seemed to be pointing to his mind, and then I lost myself in my imagination for a while exploring the detail of the eyes, the tie, the coat and the ring - captured by the elegance of it all. Then, in a flash, my entire dream came back to me in vivid detail - and woah what a dream.

content_blocks.text: I had spent hours in the company of my eldest son, who died a few years ago - the anniversary of his death had been the day before and I had been thinking then, about how rarely I see him in my dreams. I was startled to realise just how long and vivid my dream visit had been - and yet I had retained absolutely no memory of it until a detail in this image brought it back to me.  (So how many other times am I meeting him in a dream state, and not remembering anything about it afterwards?)
content_blocks.html: I had spent hours in the company of my eldest son, who died a few years ago - the anniversary of his death had been the day before and I had been thinking then, about how rarely I see him in my dreams. I was startled to realise just how long and vivid my dream visit had been - and yet I had retained absolutely no memory of it until a detail in this image brought it back to me.  (So how many other times am I meeting him in a dream state, and not remembering anything about it afterwards?)

content_blocks.text: The finger detail kicked me off, but it was the coat that did it - because in my dream I was on a shopping trip with my son, and we were looking at things, laughing about things, and he was carrying around this coat (the one Wilde is wearing), unsure whether to buy it or not, until I bought it for him - and he laughed, because he knew that I would. (Remember, I dreamed of this coat, before I found the image of it after I woke up again).It was really a delightful dream that meant a lot to me in many different ways. My son had spent most of his life living in Dublin so I was reminded of the visit the two of us made to see the house where Oscar Wilde was born, and how we had larked around taking photos of the statue of him in the park in front of that house.
content_blocks.html:
The finger detail kicked me off, but it was the coat that did it - because in my dream I was on a shopping trip with my son, and we were looking at things, laughing about things, and he was carrying around this coat (the one Wilde is wearing), unsure whether to buy it or not, until I bought it for him - and he laughed, because he knew that I would. (Remember, I dreamed of this coat, before I found the image of it after I woke up again).  

It was really a delightful dream that meant a lot to me in many different ways. My son had spent most of his life living in Dublin so I was reminded of the visit the two of us made to see the house where Oscar Wilde was born, and how we had larked around taking photos of the statue of him in the park in front of that house.

content_blocks.text: What I had never realised, until after my dream, was that Wilde was also a student of Trinity College, Dublin, where my son worked for most of his life as a lecturer - so they had walked the same streets, shared the same learning spaces, and both of them died too soon.
content_blocks.html: What I had never realised, until after my dream, was that Wilde was also a student of Trinity College, Dublin, where my son worked for most of his life as a lecturer - so they had walked the same streets, shared the same learning spaces, and both of them died too soon.

content_blocks.text: I am even more fond of Oscar Wilde now - in real life my son would never have worn a coat as flamboyant as that, but it hangs on Oscar so well; I am glad he had such a great sense of style as well as wit. My son had a great sense of wit, as well as a great sense of humour.
content_blocks.html: I am even more fond of Oscar Wilde now - in real life my son would never have worn a coat as flamboyant as that, but it hangs on Oscar so well; I am glad he had such a great sense of style as well as wit. My son had a great sense of wit, as well as a great sense of humour.

content_blocks.author: Aurora
content_blocks.text: Oh... I am so sorry. Glad for the wonderful dream! But so very sorry for your loss. I have a son serving overseas; I pray a lot. ;)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Thank you Aurora - blessings to you son to keep him safe. Dx

content_blocks.author: Kealoha Cristiano
content_blocks.text:
Aloha Deborah,

... Thanks for sharing.
Beautiful to witness Mother's love.

Blessed be,

content_blocks.author: Drums
content_blocks.text: Beautiful! What a gift.

content_blocks.author: Nina Gryphon
content_blocks.text: Deborah, it feels almost as if your son was using the image of Oscar Wilde to make that dream connection with you, taking you back to the trip to Oscar Wilde's house you both took. That's why you bought him the coat in the dream -- it was you making the connection between some of the details of Wilde's life and that of your son. How lovely and moving.

content_blocks.author: Emma Gardiner
content_blocks.text: Wow what an interesting dream! I really value your openness, Deb, thank you for sharing this with us.

content_blocks.author: Samantha Blackadder
content_blocks.text:
Thank you for the moving dream share Deb 🤍✨️ It's a heart healing moment to realise our beloved dead are not that far away at all.

Astro wise, as I read this, I noticed Oscars L9 - Venus is now conjunct his Sun, and the nodes are activating his Uranus/Mercury opposition in the 9th/3rd house. Seems you were sharing a dream with Oscars spirit!

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text:
What an encounter for you, and for you to share with us.

And such a vivid illustration of the magic of a softer, more allowing gaze over fixating on a chart and almost demanding revelation.

content_blocks.author: Jeanette Han
content_blocks.text: So beautifully expressed and filled with so much love. It's a gift when that drowsy feeling comes over us and we don't resist it. Instead, we meet our loved ones and feel the connection that's always been there. Our busy minds and lives need to shut down for a moment so they can slip through and share their love once more 💛 Thank you for sharing your personal experience, it was tender and filled with joy too.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: What an amazing and very moving share Deb :) Thanks as always for your trust in us and for opening up so honestly.  It goes to show how flimsy the veil is between our waking and sleeping worlds.  And also how those who have sadly moved away from us are still there.  Warmest thoughts to you.

As I resumed work and found this image I became fascinated as I worked on it, like his eyes were really staring at me - I wondered why his finger seemed to be pointing to his mind, and then I lost myself in my imagination for a while exploring the detail of the eyes, the tie, the coat and the ring - captured by the elegance of it all. Then, in a flash, my entire dream came back to me in vivid detail - and woah what a dream.    
I had spent hours in the company of my eldest son, who died a few years ago - the anniversary of his death had been the day before and I had been thinking then, about how rarely I see him in my dreams. I was startled to realise just how long and vivid my dream visit had been - and yet I had retained absolutely no memory of it until a detail in this image brought it back to me.  (So how many other times am I meeting him in a dream state, and not remembering anything about it afterwards?)
The finger detail kicked me off, but it was the coat that did it - because in my dream I was on a shopping trip with my son, and we were looking at things, laughing about things, and he was carrying around this coat (the one Wilde is wearing), unsure whether to buy it or not, until I bought it for him - and he laughed, because he knew that I would. (Remember, I dreamed of this coat, before I found the image of it after I woke up again).  

It was really a delightful dream that meant a lot to me in many different ways. My son had spent most of his life living in Dublin so I was reminded of the visit the two of us made to see the house where Oscar Wilde was born, and how we had larked around taking photos of the statue of him in the park in front of that house. 
What I had never realised, until after my dream, was that Wilde was also a student of Trinity College, Dublin, where my son worked for most of his life as a lecturer - so they had walked the same streets, shared the same learning spaces, and both of them died too soon.  
I am even more fond of Oscar Wilde now - in real life my son would never have worn a coat as flamboyant as that, but it hangs on Oscar so well; I am glad he had such a great sense of style as well as wit. My son had a great sense of wit, as well as a great sense of humour.

content_blocks.author: Kealoha Cristiano
content_blocks.text:
Aloha Everyone,

Dru, thanks for your contribution.
Beautiful work.

Sending you all waves of Aloha,

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text: I wasn't able to join this live and know I'm in for a big treat when I watch the recording. Thank you Dru and Deb for shining a light on this important topic for our community.

content_blocks.author: David ZL
content_blocks.text: Aw I had to miss this discussion :( but I wanted to share that - none of the people my age (I'm in my 20s) whether friends or school mates practice Astrology seriously. Absolutely none! Everyone only talks about the zodiac signs on SM but nothing else. And what's more they would almost blame Mercury retrograde for everything even though Mercury isn't at the time; it's become very trendy these days. I remember we were introducing ourselves in the beginning of the semester and everyone added their sun-sign after and I was shocked about how popular 'astrology' is now that everyone my generation talks about it, and they seem to know much more than I do haha. Anyway just to add a bit of something. I sound so hot-headed I'm not usually like this :)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Hopefully we'll catch up in the next one David, because it is lovely to have your involvement.  You make a good point that, on the surface, astrology has got hugely popular amongst the general public but quantity does not equate to depth of understanding.  That is not necessarily a bad thing, but I worry about astrological organisations feeling the commercial pressure to cater to everything that simplifies and brings in the popular market. I always chuckle when I see the avalanche of SM posts exclaiming fear when Mercury goes retrograde, and great relief when it goes direct again, like everything is either good or bad at those times and that's really all there is to think about :)

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: " I really believe that if the good astrologers continue to promote and share their work, the right people will find them". That has always been my anchor point too. One piece of advice I would give is to always do what pleases your own heart, without worrying about the attention or reaction you get to that from others.  Treat your creativity as a precious child in need of protection and fight for its rights - the cosmos is full of soul level connections which ensures that really good heart-filled creativity will never go unnoticed. (Although it also has its own sense of timing, so you might be like Van Gogh, and not get the big name until after you are dead, LOL).

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: This comment has been removed.

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text:
That is a sterling piece of work Dru! It is really interesting to have the astrological patterns of social shifts pointed out and explored, although I plan to stop thinking about generational divides myself - they have always been a part of life. Even in ancient times authors were moaning about the young generation, and I was recently struck by how John of Saxony considered his medieval colleagues the modern age astrologers :) 
How I laughed at that Google graphic you included showing the typical searches of people who are clearly bamboozled by it all --- "Why are boomers so offended by OK boomer?" LOL, someone actually needed Google to answer that!  Society is a funny thing; it's a bit hilarious to think of folks on all sides of divides turning to a search engine to give them common sense answers :)

content_blocks.author: Jane
content_blocks.text: Thank you to everyone who participated and for being willing to share with those who didn’t.

content_blocks.author: Joanna Grant
content_blocks.text: Thanks Dru for the presentation, it was interesting, and also everyone else for their valued insight. I particularly liked Liam's description of Social Media being like a conversation on a street... very apt I thought. Love it or hate it, social media is probably here to stay! I also loved the quote in the beginning from Elias Ashmole... true then obviously and also how true now! .

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: It was very enlightening to go through this survey, which I think was the best way to approach this topic so thanks Dru for all the hard work of putting it together. As a very long term student of astrology and just about deciding to go professional, it was important to me to hear the experience of others. I know SM is here to stay and has changed our practice but, although it does have its plus sides (connections, community of astrologers …) the trap of constant exposure and its related need to respond is something which needs to be handled - as a matter of fact after this talk I’m taking a little SM break to think it all over ! So thanks Deb for setting up this talk.

Huge, heartfelt thanks to Dru for ploughing through all that submitted data and presenting it all so elegantly (despite my interruptions :)).  I know you had an unexpected avalanche Dru, which goes to show how Social Media is both a wonderful opportunity AND a big problem for us all.  
Astrologers, as a group of people who are naturally invested in anticipating future trends, have a particular responsibility for getting a good handle on this – of all people we should be aware of how social trends are developing so quickly and blindsiding most of us.
Personally, you have made me feel a little less isolated/intimidated by it all, and a little more determined to be part of the solution rather than the problem. I will try to be more patient and understanding (perhaps blocking less people and just putting more on mute, LOL), and will also try to use hashtags too.

Add follow up comments and/or your social media details here
-----------------------------
Here are my own social media details – I am very keen to support and give follow backs to astrologers that are genuinely in my circle, but I don’t always find you easily or know how to recognise you on Social Media.  So those of you who want to, please share your own details here. Then we all have the chance to connect more strongly on SM, which is what I see as the ideal solution - social media cementing real-life relationships instead of replacing them.
Thanks again Dru, and for everyone who attended, contributed, or placed comments in the chat!  This one could have run and run I think.
Deb x

Skyscript Twitter account = https://twitter.com/Skyscript
(I recently reactivated this after a 12-year break, and I quite like it – a nice, friendly feel to it so far)
Deb Houlding personal Facebook page = https://www.facebook.com/houlding1
I’m not ever-so active, but I do like my Facebook page, and if I have anything important or substantial I want to say astrologically I usually put it there.
Deb Houlding personal Instagram = https://www.instagram.com/debhoulding/
Truth be told, I’m not quite sure what I’m doing with Instagram. I just post graphics now and then and don’t pay a lot of attention to it, but am keen to give follows to those of you who are on it.
The Skyscript Pinterest = https://www.pinterest.co.uk/houlding1/skyscript/
Nothing truly exciting happens here, but I am using this as a reservoir for the images and charts I create for Skyscript, and as a place to collect other beautiful astro-images that inspire me, so you might just enjoy visiting sometime.

I too share the love/hate relationship with social media but if I think back to my first exposure to astrology as a child it was probably from the regular media, which in today's day could have easily have been social media. Since then I've discovered some great astrologers through YouTube, I just had to separate the wheat from the chaff. I also think we have a great responsibility to continue to fill social media with real astrology because I really believe that if the good astrologers continue to promote and share their work, the right people will find them - I even found the STA through a hashtag on Instagram! Now look at what a lovely community I'm a part of :)

I also just want to say that I don't think it's essential to use social media to work as an astrologer if you're able to promote yourself effectively in person. Most of my work so far has come from in person connections.

content_blocks.text: PLEASE COMPLETE DRU'S SOCIAL MEDIA SURVEY

To get us more informed and better prepared, Dru has created a survey, inviting you to share your own experience of social media and astrology. It’s a 5 minute slice of your life that will hopefully help all of us better navigate this changing landscape, and add some discussion topics.Please feel free to share the link to the survey with your astrologer friends and on your social pages so we can get a broad, inter-generational view of how it is for everyone. We are very curious to see what this reveals.

Thanks everyone - we're both looking forward to this one very much and hope to see you there!

title: High five for Jason; low five for sterling

content_blocks.text: High five for Jason; low five for sterling
Skyscript

content_blocks.html: 5 Oct 2022

content_blocks.text: No one likes to celebrate bad news, but we can applaud a job well done.  As the last issue of the newsletter was distributed, there was no inkling that the UK was set to have a very sudden, extremely serious financial crash, which brought the value of the pound to an all-time low.  Markets erupted in turmoil and Parliament was (still is) in disarray – all in response to a ‘mini-budget’ put together by the new Prime Minister, Liz Truss, and her new Chancellor of the Exchequer, Kwasi Kwarteng, to rescue the economy! After a few days, the Bank of England stepped in with drastic measures to rescue the ailing pound, causing huge embarrassment to Truss and calls for resignation over a lack of confidence in her strategy.
content_blocks.html: No one likes to celebrate bad news, but we can applaud a job well done.  As the last issue of the newsletter was distributed, there was no inkling that the UK was set to have a very sudden, extremely serious financial crash, which brought the value of the pound to an all-time low.  Markets erupted in turmoil and Parliament was (still is) in disarray – all in response to a ‘mini-budget’ put together by the new Prime Minister, Liz Truss, and her new Chancellor of the Exchequer, Kwasi Kwarteng, to rescue the economy! After a few days, the Bank of England stepped in with drastic measures to rescue the ailing pound, causing huge embarrassment to Truss and calls for resignation over a lack of confidence in her strategy.

content_blocks.text: Despiteinsistingthat she would sustain her course, on the day retrograde Mercury stationed in direct opposition to retrograde Neptune (against a backdrop of retrograde Saturn in partile square to retrograde Uranus), a humiliating climbdown meant plans to give tax breaks to the wealthiest members of society were overturned. Truss blamed Kwasi – it was all a confusing mess: everyone talking about holding firm, no one sure what direction to be firm about.
content_blocks.html: Despite insisting that she would sustain her course, on the day retrograde Mercury stationed in direct opposition to retrograde Neptune (against a backdrop of retrograde Saturn in partile square to retrograde Uranus), a humiliating climbdown meant plans to give tax breaks to the wealthiest members of society were overturned. Truss blamed Kwasi – it was all a confusing mess: everyone talking about holding firm, no one sure what direction to be firm about.

content_blocks.text: Whilst very unexpected this was not unforeseen.  Check the details of Jason Burn’s outline of the month ahead, which warned of controversy flaring up in the UK Parliament, with issues of national resources and finances to be at the root of concerns in British politics until the end of the year (Moon on the cusp of 2nd house of the Libra ingress chart, and the triggering effect of the October full Moon with MC-ruler Mars in the ingress, showing October to be a month of particularly heightened concern).

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text: Yes, the Libra ingress quarter has only just begun...and Pluto hasn't quite reached the very end of Capricorn.

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text: I can't see how to add the full Moon chart else I'd post that too.

content_blocks.author: Leena Chauhan
content_blocks.text:
Nice work, Jason! I've been wondering where the tanking pound was reflected in the heavens. Thanks for showing us, and in advance of it happening too, through the connections between the upcoming full Moon and the UK Libra ingress charts for London.

There's more to come. Mercury trines Pluto on Friday for the third time, just as Pluto stations direct on the eve of the Aries Full Moon. In the full Moon chart for London, Mercury is on the cusp of the turned 8th house of debt, while Pluto is on the radical 8th cusp. Maybe some kind of revelation about how much trouble our currency and financial system really are in surfaces? The heavy Pluto accent coupled with the Mars-ruled culmination of the lunar cycle suggests it won't be pretty whatever it is.

Also for the third time, next Wednesday, Mercury at 1° Libra opposes Jupiter at 1° Aries. As Mercury conjoins the Libra ingress Sun, the opposition lines up with the 5th-11th axis house cusps of the London full Moon chart. After party conference season is over and MPs are 'back to school', Parliament may well have a lot more to say on the terrible mess we're in.

Mercury stationed retrograde at 8° Libra. Both the PM and the Chancellor have Pluto at 6° Libra. It seems getting into No.10 and No.11 Downing Street, their respective official addresses, went to their heads. 

I recall watching Liz Truss being proclaimed the winner of the Tory Party leadership contest. She didn't even acknowledge her husband who was sitting right next to her. Even Oscar winners embrace their plus ones! Truss was too transfixed by the stage she was about to climb on to notice her hubby. Upon gaining office, Kwasi Kwarteng fired the most senior civil servant in the Treasury and ignored pretty much everybody else, including key institutions, before announcing his 'KamiKwaze' budget. The resulting 'thumbs down' in red lights from the financial markets led to a massive loss of power for sterling as a currency, echoing the background Mercury-Jupiter and Mercury-Pluto transits.

Mercury stationing direct in Virgo requires attention to be paid to process as well as money. The headline-grabbing reversal of the decision to scrap the tax cut for the highest earners was followed by a quieter, administrative decision to provide an Office for Budget Responsibility report, showing the figures behind the budget, after all. Kwarteng's initial rejection of the need for any such report meant there were no detailed numbers backing up his proposals which contributed to spooking the markets. Mercury resuming forward motion in a dual sign shows that more than one decision needed to be turned around.

Trouble for the UK Treasury in 2022 is indicated in the UK Aries ingress too. The 11th-house ruling Moon at 29° Libra is heading for a steep decline as she hovers on the edge of Scorpio, and in square to Pluto in the turned 8th house.

content_blocks.author: CROSSLEY Mireille
content_blocks.text: Hooray for Jason 👍🥇 👏👏 on a personal note the sudden sterling fall made my day as I quickly exchanged quite a bit of euros into my UK account 😜

content_blocks.author: Skyscript
content_blocks.text: Ha ha - as my grandma used to say "when God shuts a door he opens a window" :)

full_content:
High five for Jason; low five for sterling
Skyscript
5 Oct 2022
10
8
No one likes to celebrate bad news, but we can applaud a job well done.  As the last issue of the newsletter was distributed, there was no inkling that the UK was set to have a very sudden, extremely serious financial crash, which brought the value of the pound to an all-time low.  Markets erupted in turmoil and Parliament was (still is) in disarray – all in response to a ‘mini-budget’ put together by the new Prime Minister, Liz Truss, and her new Chancellor of the Exchequer, Kwasi Kwarteng, to rescue the economy! After a few days, the Bank of England stepped in with drastic measures to rescue the ailing pound, causing huge embarrassment to Truss and calls for resignation over a lack of confidence in her strategy.
Despite insisting that she would sustain her course, on the day retrograde Mercury stationed in direct opposition to retrograde Neptune (against a backdrop of retrograde Saturn in partile square to retrograde Uranus), a humiliating climbdown meant plans to give tax breaks to the wealthiest members of society were overturned. Truss blamed Kwasi – it was all a confusing mess: everyone talking about holding firm, no one sure what direction to be firm about.
Whilst very unexpected this was not unforeseen.  Check the details of Jason Burn’s outline of the month ahead, which warned of controversy flaring up in the UK Parliament, with issues of national resources and finances to be at the root of concerns in British politics until the end of the year (Moon on the cusp of 2nd house of the Libra ingress chart, and the triggering effect of the October full Moon with MC-ruler Mars in the ingress, showing October to be a month of particularly heightened concern).

content_blocks.text: Initially, this possibility had been considered and rejected, because as links on the Skyscript site show, these are definitely two separate manuscripts, with different handwriting and clear differences in how certain details are expressed.
content_blocks.html: Initially, this possibility had been considered and rejected, because as links on the Skyscript site show, these are definitely two separate manuscripts, with different handwriting and clear differences in how certain details are expressed.

content_blocks.text: With the technical details of the first three horaries emblazoned in my mind, I spent a couple of hours last night trawling through the images of the Neve document, looking to see if these ‘test charts’ are contained within it.  I only worked through the first 500 pages and will get back on the task later – but what I did notice, from the details within the chart imagery, is that the charts were drawn by the same hand. So it is possible, that even if it is not the same charts, they are originating from the same astrologer. Until such time that this can be fully resolved, I have slightly edited the page on Skyscript, to lessen the emphasis on Lilly.  I will also add a comment today to say that the authorship is in dispute and is currently being investigated.

full_content:
Authorship dispute on the 'Lilly manuscript (?)'
Skyscript
4 Oct 2022
9
1

Hi everyone,
I received a kind email from Luis Ribeiro last night, concerned that the manuscript attributed to Lilly was the same manuscript as that which has proven authorship by his contemporary, Geffrey Le Neve. 
Initially, this possibility had been considered and rejected, because as links on the Skyscript site show, these are definitely two separate manuscripts, with different handwriting and clear differences in how certain details are expressed.
With the technical details of the first three horaries emblazoned in my mind, I spent a couple of hours last night trawling through the images of the Neve document, looking to see if these ‘test charts’ are contained within it.  I only worked through the first 500 pages and will get back on the task later – but what I did notice, from the details within the chart imagery, is that the charts were drawn by the same hand. So it is possible, that even if it is not the same charts, they are originating from the same astrologer. Until such time that this can be fully resolved, I have slightly edited the page on Skyscript, to lessen the emphasis on Lilly.  I will also add a comment today to say that the authorship is in dispute and is currently being investigated.
The link on Skyscript has also been changed to the following, to keep a more neutral URL:
https://www.skyscript.co.uk/207_horaries.html 
(The old link still work but as a forwarder to this new page).
I know that Chris Mitchell is away in France at the moment, so I am loathed to do too much without his involvement or until such time that a planned open discussion of the manuscript has been held. In any event, this is a wonderful document that is extremely important and valuable in its own right, whoever authored it. Naturally, I am very keen to ensure that the attribution details are as correct as they can be, and that while there is doubt about that, the doubt is part of the record.
It's early days on this exciting find so I will keep you updated as facts come to light.
1 comment

 Hi everyone,

I'll be circulating the next issue of the Skyscript newsletter in a couple of days. https://www.skyscript.co.uk/libra.html 
Although I realise that no seasoned astrologer lacks understanding of the Sun-signs, this article goes a little deeper into the origin of the symbolic principles than most. I am enjoying getting the newsletter finalised - more from me later.
Best wishes
Deb
